is extended with arbitrary additional events, the resulting event list is still a trace (cf. process
properties @{term process_prop_5} and @{term process_prop_6} in \cite{R2}). Therefore, if @{term xs}
were a divergence, then @{term "xs @ [None, None]"} would be a trace, which is impossible in case
the process satisfies predicate @{term weakly_sequential}.

\null
â€º

inductive_set seq_comp_failures ::
 "'a option process â‡’ 'a option process â‡’ 'a option failure set"
for P :: "'a option process" and Q :: "'a option process" where

SCF_R1: "âŸ¦xs âˆ‰ sentences P; (xs, X) âˆˆ failures P; None âˆ‰ set xsâŸ§ âŸ¹
  (xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" |

SCF_R2: "âŸ¦xs âˆˆ sentences P; (xs, X) âˆˆ failures P; ([], Y) âˆˆ failures QâŸ§ âŸ¹
  (xs, insert None X âˆ© Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" |

SCF_R3: "âŸ¦xs âˆˆ sentences P; (ys, Y) âˆˆ failures Q; ys â‰  []âŸ§ âŸ¹
  (xs @ ys, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" |

SCF_R4: "âŸ¦(xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q; (xs, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P QâŸ§ âŸ¹
  (xs, X âˆª Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"

definition seq_comp ::
 "'a option process â‡’ 'a option process â‡’ 'a option process" (infixl ";" 60)
where
"P ; Q â‰¡ Abs_process (seq_comp_failures P Q, {})"

text â€¹
\null

Here below is the proof that, for any two processes @{term P}, @{term Q} defined over the same
alphabet containing successful termination, set @{term "seq_comp_failures P Q"} indeed enjoys the
characteristic properties of the failures set of a process as defined in \cite{R2} provided that
@{term P} is weakly sequential, which is what happens in any meaningful case.

\null
â€º

lemma seq_comp_prop_1:
 "([], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof (cases "[] âˆˆ sentences P")
  case False
  moreover have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
   by (rule process_rule_1)
  moreover have "None âˆ‰ set []"
   by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
   by (rule SCF_R1)
next
  case True
  moreover have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
   by (rule process_rule_1)
  moreover have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
   by (rule process_rule_1)
  ultimately have "([], {None} âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule SCF_R2)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma seq_comp_prop_2_aux [rule_format]:
  assumes WS: "weakly_sequential P"
  shows "(ws, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹
    ws = xs @ [x] âŸ¶ (xs, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof (erule seq_comp_failures.induct, rule_tac [!] impI, simp_all, erule conjE)
  fix X'
  assume
    A: "(xs @ [x], X') âˆˆ failures P" and
    B: "None âˆ‰ set xs"
  have A': "(xs, {}) âˆˆ failures P"
   using A by (rule process_rule_2)
  show "(xs, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof (cases "xs âˆˆ sentences P")
    case False
    thus ?thesis
     using A' and B by (rule SCF_R1)
  next
    case True
    have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
     by (rule process_rule_1)
    with True and A' have "(xs, {None} âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by (rule SCF_R2)
    thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
next
  fix X'
  assume A: "(xs @ [x], X') âˆˆ failures P"
  hence A': "(xs, {}) âˆˆ failures P"
   by (rule process_rule_2)
  show "(xs, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof (cases "xs âˆˆ sentences P")
    case False
    have "âˆ€xs âˆˆ traces P. None âˆ‰ set (butlast xs)"
     using WS by (simp add: weakly_sequential_def)
    moreover have "xs @ [x] âˆˆ traces P"
     using A by (rule failures_traces)
    ultimately have "None âˆ‰ set (butlast (xs @ [x]))" ..
    hence "None âˆ‰ set xs" by simp
    with False and A' show ?thesis
     by (rule SCF_R1)
  next
    case True
    have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
     by (rule process_rule_1)
    with True and A' have "(xs, {None} âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by (rule SCF_R2)
    thus ?thesis by simp
  qed
next
  fix xs' ys Y
  assume
    A: "xs' @ ys = xs @ [x]" and
    B: "xs' âˆˆ sentences P" and
    C: "(ys, Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
    D: "ys â‰  []"
  have "âˆƒy ys'. ys = ys' @ [y]"
   using D by (rule_tac xs = ys in rev_cases, simp_all)
  then obtain y and ys' where D': "ys = ys' @ [y]"
   by blast
  hence "xs = xs' @ ys'"
   using A by simp
  thus "(xs, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof (cases "ys' = []", simp_all)
    case True
    have "xs' @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
     using B by (simp add: sentences_def)
    hence "xs' âˆˆ traces P"
     by (rule process_rule_2_traces)
    hence "(xs', {}) âˆˆ failures P"
     by (rule traces_failures)
    moreover have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
     by (rule process_rule_1)
    ultimately have "(xs', {None} âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by (rule SCF_R2 [OF B])
    thus "(xs', {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by simp
  next
    case False
    have "(ys' @ [y], Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
     using C and D' by simp
    hence C': "(ys', {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
     by (rule process_rule_2)
    with B show "(xs' @ ys', {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     using False by (rule SCF_R3)
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_prop_2:
  assumes WS: "weakly_sequential P"
  shows "(xs @ [x], X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹
    (xs, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
by (erule seq_comp_prop_2_aux [OF WS], simp)

lemma seq_comp_prop_3 [rule_format]:
 "(xs, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹ X âŠ† Y âŸ¶
    (xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof (induction arbitrary: X rule: seq_comp_failures.induct, rule_tac [!] impI)
  fix xs X Y
  assume
    A: "xs âˆ‰ sentences P" and
    B: "(xs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    C: "None âˆ‰ set xs" and
    D: "Y âŠ† X"
  have "(xs, Y) âˆˆ failures P"
   using B and D by (rule process_rule_3)
  with A show "(xs, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   using C by (rule SCF_R1)
next
  fix xs X Y Z
  assume
    A: "xs âˆˆ sentences P" and
    B: "(xs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    C: "([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
    D: "Z âŠ† insert None X âˆ© Y"
  have "Z - {None} âŠ† X"
   using D by blast
  with B have "(xs, Z - {None}) âˆˆ failures P"
   by (rule process_rule_3)
  moreover have "Z âŠ† Y"
   using D by simp
  with C have "([], Z) âˆˆ failures Q"
   by (rule process_rule_3)
  ultimately have "(xs, insert None (Z - {None}) âˆ© Z) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule SCF_R2 [OF A])
  moreover have "insert None (Z - {None}) âˆ© Z = Z"
   by blast
  ultimately show "(xs, Z) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by simp
next
  fix xs ys X Y
  assume
    A: "xs âˆˆ sentences P" and
    B: "(ys, Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
    C: "ys â‰  []" and
    D: "X âŠ† Y"
  have "(ys, X) âˆˆ failures Q"
   using B and D by (rule process_rule_3)
  with A show "(xs @ ys, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   using C by (rule SCF_R3)
next
  fix xs X Y Z
  assume
    A: "â‹€W. W âŠ† X âŸ¶ (xs, W) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
    B: "â‹€W. W âŠ† Y âŸ¶ (xs, W) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
    C: "Z âŠ† X âˆª Y"
  have "Z âˆ© X âŠ† X âŸ¶ (xs, Z âˆ© X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   using A .
  hence "(xs, Z âˆ© X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by simp
  moreover have "Z âˆ© Y âŠ† Y âŸ¶ (xs, Z âˆ© Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   using B .
  hence "(xs, Z âˆ© Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by simp
  ultimately have "(xs, Z âˆ© X âˆª Z âˆ© Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule SCF_R4)
  hence "(xs, Z âˆ© (X âˆª Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (simp add: Int_Un_distrib)
  moreover have "Z âˆ© (X âˆª Y) = Z"
   using C by (rule Int_absorb2)
  ultimately show "(xs, Z) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by simp
qed

lemma seq_comp_prop_4:
  assumes WS: "weakly_sequential P"
  shows "(xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹
    (xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ¨
    (xs, insert x X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof (erule seq_comp_failures.induct, simp_all)
  fix xs X
  assume
    A: "xs âˆ‰ sentences P" and
    B: "(xs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    C: "None âˆ‰ set xs"
  have "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
    (xs, insert x X) âˆˆ failures P"
   using B by (rule process_rule_4)
  thus "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ¨
    (xs, insert x X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof
    assume D: "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
    show ?thesis
    proof (cases "xs @ [x] âˆˆ sentences P")
      case False
      have "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [x])"
      proof (simp add: C, rule notI)
        assume "None = x"
        hence "(xs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
         using D by simp
        hence "xs @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule failures_traces)
        hence "xs âˆˆ sentences P"
         by (simp add: sentences_def)
        thus False
         using A by contradiction
      qed
      with False and D have "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R1)
      thus ?thesis ..
    next
      case True
      have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
       by (rule process_rule_1)
      with True and D have "(xs @ [x], {None} âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R2)
      thus ?thesis by simp
    qed
  next
    assume "(xs, insert x X) âˆˆ failures P"
    with A have "(xs, insert x X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     using C by (rule SCF_R1)
    thus ?thesis ..
  qed
next
  fix xs X Y
  assume
    A: "xs âˆˆ sentences P" and
    B: "(xs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    C: "([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
  show "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ¨
    (xs, insert x (insert None X âˆ© Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof (cases "x = None", simp)
    case True
    have "([] @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ¨ ([], insert None Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
     using C by (rule process_rule_4)
    thus "(xs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ¨
      (xs, insert None (insert None X âˆ© Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
    proof (rule disjE, simp)
      assume "([None], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
      moreover have "[None] â‰  []"
       by simp
      ultimately have "(xs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R3 [OF A])
      thus ?thesis ..
    next
      assume "([], insert None Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
      with A and B have "(xs, insert None X âˆ© insert None Y)
        âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R2)
      moreover have "insert None X âˆ© insert None Y =
        insert None (insert None X âˆ© Y)"
       by blast
      ultimately have "(xs, insert None (insert None X âˆ© Y))
        âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by simp
      thus ?thesis ..
    qed
  next
    case False
    have "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨ (xs, insert x X) âˆˆ failures P"
     using B by (rule process_rule_4)
    thus ?thesis
    proof (rule disjE, cases "xs @ [x] âˆˆ sentences P")
      assume
        D: "xs @ [x] âˆ‰ sentences P" and
        E: "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
      have "None âˆ‰ set xs"
       using WS and A by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
      hence "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [x])"
       using False by (simp del: not_None_eq)
      with D and E have "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R1)
      thus ?thesis ..
    next
      assume
        "xs @ [x] âˆˆ sentences P" and
        "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
      moreover have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
       by (rule process_rule_1)
      ultimately have "(xs @ [x], {None} âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R2)
      thus ?thesis by simp
    next
      assume D: "(xs, insert x X) âˆˆ failures P"
      have "([] @ [x], {}) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ¨ ([], insert x Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
       using C by (rule process_rule_4)
      thus ?thesis
      proof (rule disjE, simp)
        assume "([x], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
        moreover have "[x] â‰  []"
         by simp
        ultimately have "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
         by (rule SCF_R3 [OF A])
        thus ?thesis ..
      next
        assume "([], insert x Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
        with A and D have "(xs, insert None (insert x X) âˆ© insert x Y)
          âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
         by (rule SCF_R2)
        moreover have "insert None (insert x X) âˆ© insert x Y =
          insert x (insert None X âˆ© Y)"
         by blast
        ultimately have "(xs, insert x (insert None X âˆ© Y))
          âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
         by simp
        thus ?thesis ..
      qed
    qed
  qed
next
  fix xs ys Y
  assume
    A: "xs âˆˆ sentences P" and
    B: "(ys, Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
    C: "ys â‰  []"
  have "(ys @ [x], {}) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ¨ (ys, insert x Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
   using B by (rule process_rule_4)
  thus "(xs @ ys @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ¨
    (xs @ ys, insert x Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof
    assume "(ys @ [x], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
    moreover have "ys @ [x] â‰  []"
     by simp
    ultimately have "(xs @ ys @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by (rule SCF_R3 [OF A])
    thus ?thesis ..
  next
    assume "(ys, insert x Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
    with A have "(xs @ ys, insert x Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     using C by (rule SCF_R3)
    thus ?thesis ..
  qed
next
  fix xs X Y
  assume
    "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ¨
      (xs, insert x X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
    "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ¨
      (xs, insert x Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  thus "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ¨
    (xs, insert x (X âˆª Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof (cases "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q", simp_all)
    assume
      "(xs, insert x X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
      "(xs, insert x Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
    hence "(xs, insert x X âˆª insert x Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by (rule SCF_R4)
    thus "(xs, insert x (X âˆª Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by simp
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_rep:
  assumes WS: "weakly_sequential P"
  shows "Rep_process (P ; Q) = (seq_comp_failures P Q, {})"
proof (subst seq_comp_def, rule Abs_process_inverse, simp add: process_set_def,
 (subst conj_assoc [symmetric])+, (rule conjI)+)
  show "process_prop_1 (seq_comp_failures P Q, {})"
  proof (simp add: process_prop_1_def)
  qed (rule seq_comp_prop_1)
next
  show "process_prop_2 (seq_comp_failures P Q, {})"
  proof (simp add: process_prop_2_def del: all_simps, (rule allI)+, rule impI)
  qed (rule seq_comp_prop_2 [OF WS])
next
  show "process_prop_3 (seq_comp_failures P Q, {})"
  proof (simp add: process_prop_3_def del: all_simps, (rule allI)+, rule impI,
   erule conjE)
  qed (rule seq_comp_prop_3)
next
  show "process_prop_4 (seq_comp_failures P Q, {})"
  proof (simp add: process_prop_4_def, (rule allI)+, rule impI)
  qed (rule seq_comp_prop_4 [OF WS])
next
  show "process_prop_5 (seq_comp_failures P Q, {})"
   by (simp add: process_prop_5_def)
next
  show "process_prop_6 (seq_comp_failures P Q, {})"
   by (simp add: process_prop_6_def)
qed

text â€¹
\null

Here below, the previous result is applied to derive useful expressions for the outputs of the
functions returning the elements of a process, as defined in \cite{R2} and \cite{R3}, when acting on
the sequential composition of a pair of processes.

\null
â€º

lemma seq_comp_failures:
 "weakly_sequential P âŸ¹
    failures (P ; Q) = seq_comp_failures P Q"
by (drule seq_comp_rep [where Q = Q], simp add: failures_def)

lemma seq_comp_divergences:
 "weakly_sequential P âŸ¹
    divergences (P ; Q) = {}"
by (drule seq_comp_rep [where Q = Q], simp add: divergences_def)

lemma seq_comp_futures:
 "weakly_sequential P âŸ¹
    futures (P ; Q) xs = {(ys, Y). (xs @ ys, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q}"
by (simp add: futures_def seq_comp_failures)

lemma seq_comp_traces:
 "weakly_sequential P âŸ¹
    traces (P ; Q) = Domain (seq_comp_failures P Q)"
by (simp add: traces_def seq_comp_failures)

lemma seq_comp_refusals:
 "weakly_sequential P âŸ¹
    refusals (P ; Q) xs â‰¡ seq_comp_failures P Q `` {xs}"
by (simp add: refusals_def seq_comp_failures)

lemma seq_comp_next_events:
 "weakly_sequential P âŸ¹
    next_events (P ; Q) xs = {x. xs @ [x] âˆˆ Domain (seq_comp_failures P Q)}"
by (simp add: next_events_def seq_comp_traces)


subsection "Conservation of refusals union closure and sequentiality under sequential composition"

text â€¹
Here below is the proof that, for any two processes @{term P}, @{term Q} and any failure
@{term "(xs, X)"} of @{term "P ; Q"}, the refusal @{term X} is the union of a set of refusals where,
for any such refusal @{term W}, @{term "(xs, W)"} is a failure of @{term "P ; Q"} by virtue of one
of rules â€¹SCF_R1â€º, â€¹SCF_R2â€º, or â€¹SCF_R3â€º.

The converse is also proven, under the assumption that the refusals of both @{term P} and @{term Q}
be closed under union: namely, for any trace @{term xs} of @{term "P ; Q"} and any set of refusals
where, for any such refusal @{term W}, @{term "(xs, W)"} is a failure of the aforesaid kind, the
union of these refusals is still a refusal of @{term xs}.

The proof of the latter lemma makes use of the axiom of choice.

\null
â€º

lemma seq_comp_refusals_1:
 "(xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹ âˆƒR.
    X = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
    (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      xs âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs, U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
        W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
    (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
      take (length xs - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length xs - n) xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q) âˆ§
    (âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n)"
  (is "_ âŸ¹ âˆƒR. ?T R xs X")
proof (erule seq_comp_failures.induct, (erule_tac [4] exE)+)
  fix xs X
  assume
    A: "xs âˆ‰ sentences P" and
    B: "(xs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    C: "None âˆ‰ set xs"
  show "âˆƒR. ?T R xs X"
  proof (rule_tac x = "Î»n. if n = 0 then {X} else {}" in exI,
   simp add: A B C, rule equalityI, rule_tac [!] subsetI, simp_all)
    fix x
    assume "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}.
      âˆƒW âˆˆ if n = 0 then {X} else {}. x âˆˆ W"
    thus "x âˆˆ X"
     by (simp split: if_split_asm)
  qed
next
  fix xs X Y
  assume
    A: "xs âˆˆ sentences P" and
    B: "(xs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    C: "([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
  show "âˆƒR. ?T R xs (insert None X âˆ© Y)"
  proof (rule_tac x = "Î»n. if n = 0 then {insert None X âˆ© Y} else {}" in exI,
   simp add: A, rule conjI, rule equalityI, rule_tac [1-2] subsetI, simp_all)
    fix x
    assume "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}.
      âˆƒW âˆˆ if n = 0 then {insert None X âˆ© Y} else {}. x âˆˆ W"
    thus "(x = None âˆ¨ x âˆˆ X) âˆ§ x âˆˆ Y"
     by (simp split: if_split_asm)
  next
    show "âˆƒU. (xs, U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ (âˆƒV. ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
      insert None X âˆ© Y = insert None U âˆ© V)"
    proof (rule_tac x = X in exI, rule conjI, simp add: B)
    qed (rule_tac x = Y in exI, rule conjI, simp_all add: C)
  qed
next
  fix xs ys Y
  assume
    A: "xs âˆˆ sentences P" and
    B: "(ys, Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
    C: "ys â‰  []"
  show "âˆƒR. ?T R (xs @ ys) Y"
  proof (rule_tac x = "Î»n. if n = length ys then {Y} else {}" in exI,
   simp add: A B C, rule equalityI, rule_tac [!] subsetI, simp_all)
    fix x
    assume "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs + length ys}.
      âˆƒW âˆˆ if n = length ys then {Y} else {}. x âˆˆ W"
    thus "x âˆˆ Y"
     by (simp split: if_split_asm)
  qed
next
  fix xs X Y Rx Ry
  assume
    A: "?T Rx xs X" and
    B: "?T Ry xs Y"
  show "âˆƒR. ?T R xs (X âˆª Y)"
  proof (rule_tac x = "Î»n. Rx n âˆª Ry n" in exI, rule conjI, rule_tac [2] conjI,
   rule_tac [3] conjI, rule_tac [2] ballI, (rule_tac [3] ballI)+)
    have "X âˆª Y = (â‹ƒn â‰¤ length xs. â‹ƒW âˆˆ Rx n. W) âˆª
      (â‹ƒn â‰¤ length xs. â‹ƒW âˆˆ Ry n. W)"
     using A and B by simp
    also have "â€¦ = (â‹ƒn â‰¤ length xs. (â‹ƒW âˆˆ Rx n. W) âˆª (â‹ƒW âˆˆ Ry n. W))"
     by blast
    also have "â€¦ = (â‹ƒn â‰¤ length xs. â‹ƒW âˆˆ Rx n âˆª Ry n. W)"
     by simp
    finally show "X âˆª Y = (â‹ƒn â‰¤ length xs. â‹ƒW âˆˆ Rx n âˆª Ry n. W)" .
  next
    fix W
    assume "W âˆˆ Rx 0 âˆª Ry 0"
    thus
     "xs âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs, U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
        W = insert None U âˆ© V)"
      (is "?T' W")
    proof
      have "âˆ€W âˆˆ Rx 0. ?T' W"
       using A by simp
      moreover assume "W âˆˆ Rx 0"
      ultimately show ?thesis ..
    next
      have "âˆ€W âˆˆ Ry 0. ?T' W"
       using B by simp
      moreover assume "W âˆˆ Ry 0"
      ultimately show ?thesis ..
    qed
  next
    fix n W
    assume C: "n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}"
    assume "W âˆˆ Rx n âˆª Ry n"
    thus
     "take (length xs - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length xs - n) xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q"
      (is "?T' n W")
    proof
      have "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}. âˆ€W âˆˆ Rx n. ?T' n W"
       using A by simp
      hence "âˆ€W âˆˆ Rx n. ?T' n W"
       using C ..
      moreover assume "W âˆˆ Rx n"
      ultimately show ?thesis ..
    next
      have "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}. âˆ€W âˆˆ Ry n. ?T' n W"
       using B by simp
      hence "âˆ€W âˆˆ Ry n. ?T' n W"
       using C ..
      moreover assume "W âˆˆ Ry n"
      ultimately show ?thesis ..
    qed
  next
    have "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ Rx n"
     using A by simp
    then obtain n where C: "n âˆˆ {..length xs}" and D: "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ Rx n" ..
    obtain W where "W âˆˆ Rx n"
     using D ..
    hence "W âˆˆ Rx n âˆª Ry n" ..
    hence "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ Rx n âˆª Ry n" ..
    thus "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ Rx n âˆª Ry n"
     using C ..
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_refusals_finite [rule_format]:
  assumes A: "xs âˆˆ Domain (seq_comp_failures P Q)"
  shows "finite A âŸ¹ (âˆ€x âˆˆ A. (xs, F x) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q) âŸ¶
    (xs, â‹ƒx âˆˆ A. F x) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof (erule finite_induct, simp, rule_tac [2] impI)
  have "âˆƒX. (xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   using A by (simp add: Domain_iff)
  then obtain X where "(xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" ..
  moreover have "{} âŠ† X" ..
  ultimately show "(xs, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_prop_3)
next
  fix x' A
  assume B: "âˆ€x âˆˆ insert x' A. (xs, F x) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  hence "(xs, F x') âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by simp
  moreover assume "(âˆ€x âˆˆ A. (xs, F x) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q) âŸ¶
    (xs, â‹ƒx âˆˆ A. F x) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  hence "(xs, â‹ƒx âˆˆ A. F x) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   using B by simp
  ultimately have "(xs, F x' âˆª (â‹ƒx âˆˆ A. F x)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule SCF_R4)
  thus "(xs, â‹ƒx âˆˆ insert x' A. F x) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by simp
qed

lemma seq_comp_refusals_2:
  assumes
    A: "ref_union_closed P" and
    B: "ref_union_closed Q" and
    C: "xs âˆˆ Domain (seq_comp_failures P Q)" and
    D: "X = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
      (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
        xs âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
        xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs, U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
          W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
      (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
        take (length xs - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
        (drop (length xs - n) xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q)"
  shows "(xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof -
  have "âˆƒY. (xs, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   using C by (simp add: Domain_iff)
  then obtain Y where "(xs, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" ..
  moreover have "{} âŠ† Y" ..
  ultimately have E: "(xs, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_prop_3)
  have "(xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R 0. W) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof (cases "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0", cases "xs âˆˆ sentences P")
    assume "Â¬ (âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0)"
    thus ?thesis
     using E by simp
  next
    assume
      F: "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0" and
      G: "xs âˆ‰ sentences P"
    have H: "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0. None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P"
     using D and G by simp
    show ?thesis
    proof (rule SCF_R1 [OF G])
      have "âˆ€xs A. (âˆƒW. W âˆˆ A) âŸ¶ (âˆ€W âˆˆ A. (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P) âŸ¶
        (xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ A. W) âˆˆ failures P"
       using A by (simp add: ref_union_closed_def)
      hence "(âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0) âŸ¶ (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0. (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P) âŸ¶
        (xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R 0. W) âˆˆ failures P"
       by blast
      thus "(xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R 0. W) âˆˆ failures P"
       using F and H by simp
    next
      obtain W where "W âˆˆ R 0" using F ..
      thus "None âˆ‰ set xs"
       using H by simp
    qed
  next
    assume
      F: "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0" and
      G: "xs âˆˆ sentences P"
    have "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0. âˆƒU V. (xs, U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
      W = insert None U âˆ© V"
     using D and G by simp
    hence "âˆƒF. âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0. âˆƒV. (xs, F W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
      W = insert None (F W) âˆ© V"
     by (rule bchoice)
    then obtain F where "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      âˆƒV. (xs, F W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
        W = insert None (F W) âˆ© V" ..
    hence "âˆƒG. âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0. (xs, F W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], G W) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
      W = insert None (F W) âˆ© G W"
     by (rule bchoice)
    then obtain G where H: "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      (xs, F W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], G W) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
        W = insert None (F W) âˆ© G W" ..
    have "(xs, insert None (â‹ƒW âˆˆ R 0. F W) âˆ© (â‹ƒW âˆˆ R 0. G W))
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
      (is "(_, ?S) âˆˆ _")
    proof (rule SCF_R2 [OF G])
      have "âˆ€xs A. (âˆƒX. X âˆˆ A) âŸ¶ (âˆ€X âˆˆ A. (xs, X) âˆˆ failures P) âŸ¶
        (xs, â‹ƒX âˆˆ A. X) âˆˆ failures P"
       using A by (simp add: ref_union_closed_def)
      hence "(âˆƒX. X âˆˆ F ` R 0) âŸ¶ (âˆ€X âˆˆ F ` R 0. (xs, X) âˆˆ failures P) âŸ¶
        (xs, â‹ƒX âˆˆ F ` R 0. X) âˆˆ failures P"
        (is "?A âŸ¶ ?B âŸ¶ ?C")
       by (erule_tac x = xs in allE, erule_tac x = "F ` R 0" in allE)
      moreover obtain W where "W âˆˆ R 0" using F ..
      hence ?A
      proof (simp add: image_def, rule_tac x = "F W" in exI)
      qed (rule bexI, simp)
      ultimately have "?B âŸ¶ ?C" ..
      moreover have ?B
      proof (rule ballI, simp add: image_def, erule bexE)
        fix W X
        assume "W âˆˆ R 0"
        hence "(xs, F W) âˆˆ failures P"
         using H by simp
        moreover assume "X = F W"
        ultimately show "(xs, X) âˆˆ failures P"
         by simp
      qed
      ultimately have ?C ..
      thus "(xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R 0. F W) âˆˆ failures P"
       by simp
    next
      have "âˆ€xs A. (âˆƒY. Y âˆˆ A) âŸ¶ (âˆ€Y âˆˆ A. (xs, Y) âˆˆ failures Q) âŸ¶
        (xs, â‹ƒY âˆˆ A. Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
       using B by (simp add: ref_union_closed_def)
      hence "(âˆƒY. Y âˆˆ G ` R 0) âŸ¶ (âˆ€Y âˆˆ G ` R 0. ([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q) âŸ¶
        ([], â‹ƒY âˆˆ G ` R 0. Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
        (is "?A âŸ¶ ?B âŸ¶ ?C")
       by (erule_tac x = "[]" in allE, erule_tac x = "G ` R 0" in allE)
      moreover obtain W where "W âˆˆ R 0" using F ..
      hence ?A
      proof (simp add: image_def, rule_tac x = "G W" in exI)
      qed (rule bexI, simp)
      ultimately have "?B âŸ¶ ?C" ..
      moreover have ?B
      proof (rule ballI, simp add: image_def, erule bexE)
        fix W Y
        assume "W âˆˆ R 0"
        hence "([], G W) âˆˆ failures Q"
         using H by simp
        moreover assume "Y = G W"
        ultimately show "([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
         by simp
      qed
      ultimately have ?C ..
      thus "([], â‹ƒW âˆˆ R 0. G W) âˆˆ failures Q"
       by simp
    qed
    moreover have "(â‹ƒW âˆˆ R 0. W) âŠ† ?S"
    proof (rule subsetI, simp, erule bexE)
      fix x W
      assume I: "W âˆˆ R 0"
      hence "W = insert None (F W) âˆ© G W"
       using H by simp
      moreover assume "x âˆˆ W"
      ultimately have "x âˆˆ insert None (F W) âˆ© G W"
       by simp
      thus "(x = None âˆ¨ (âˆƒW âˆˆ R 0. x âˆˆ F W)) âˆ§ (âˆƒW âˆˆ R 0. x âˆˆ G W)"
        (is "?A âˆ§ ?B")
      proof (rule IntE, simp)
        assume "x = None âˆ¨ x âˆˆ F W"
        moreover {
          assume "x = None"
          hence ?A ..
        }
        moreover {
          assume "x âˆˆ F W"
          hence "âˆƒW âˆˆ R 0. x âˆˆ F W" using I ..
          hence ?A ..
        }
        ultimately have ?A ..
        moreover assume "x âˆˆ G W"
        hence ?B using I ..
        ultimately show ?thesis ..
      qed
    qed
    ultimately show ?thesis
     by (rule seq_comp_prop_3)
  qed
  moreover have "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}.
    (xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof
    fix n
    assume F: "n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}"
    hence G: "âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
      take (length xs - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length xs - n) xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q"
     using D by simp
    show "(xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
    proof (cases "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n")
      case False
      thus ?thesis
       using E by simp
    next
      case True
      have "(take (length xs - n) xs @ drop (length xs - n) xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W)
        âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
      proof (rule SCF_R3)
        obtain W where "W âˆˆ R n" using True ..
        thus "take (length xs - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P"
         using G by simp
      next
        have "âˆ€xs A. (âˆƒW. W âˆˆ A) âŸ¶ (âˆ€W âˆˆ A. (xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q) âŸ¶
          (xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ A. W) âˆˆ failures Q"
         using B by (simp add: ref_union_closed_def)
        hence "(âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n) âŸ¶
          (âˆ€W âˆˆ R n. (drop (length xs - n) xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q) âŸ¶
          (drop (length xs - n) xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆˆ failures Q"
         by blast
        thus "(drop (length xs - n) xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆˆ failures Q"
         using G and True by simp
      next
        show "drop (length xs - n) xs â‰  []"
         using F by (simp, arith)
      qed
      thus ?thesis
       by simp
    qed
  qed
  ultimately have F: "âˆ€n âˆˆ {..length xs}.
    (xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by auto
  have "(xs, â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  proof (rule seq_comp_refusals_finite [OF C], simp)
    fix n
    assume "n âˆˆ {..length xs}"
    with F show "(xs, â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" ..
  qed
  moreover have "X = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W)"
   using D by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
   by simp
qed

text â€¹
\null

In what follows, the previous results are used to prove that refusals union closure, weak
sequentiality, and sequentiality are conserved under sequential composition. The proof of the first
of these lemmas makes use of the axiom of choice.

Since the target security conservation theorem, in addition to the security of both of the processes
to be composed, also requires to assume that the first process be refusals union closed and
sequential (cf. below), these further conservation lemmas will permit to generalize the theorem to
the sequential composition of an arbitrary list of processes.

\null
â€º

lemma seq_comp_ref_union_closed:
  assumes
    WS: "weakly_sequential P" and
    A: "ref_union_closed P" and
    B: "ref_union_closed Q"
  shows "ref_union_closed (P ; Q)"
proof (simp only: ref_union_closed_def seq_comp_failures [OF WS],
 (rule allI)+, (rule impI)+, erule exE)
  fix xs A X'
  assume
    C: "âˆ€X âˆˆ A. (xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
    D: "X' âˆˆ A"
  have "âˆ€X âˆˆ A. âˆƒR.
    X = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
    (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      xs âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs, U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
        W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
    (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
      take (length xs - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length xs - n) xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q)"
    (is "âˆ€X âˆˆ A. âˆƒR. ?T R X")
  proof
    fix X
    assume "X âˆˆ A"
    with C have "(xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" ..
    hence "âˆƒR. X = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
      (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
        xs âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
        xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs, U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
          W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
      (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
        take (length xs - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
        (drop (length xs - n) xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q) âˆ§
      (âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n)"
     by (rule seq_comp_refusals_1)
    thus "âˆƒR. ?T R X"
     by blast
  qed
  hence "âˆƒR. âˆ€X âˆˆ A. ?T (R X) X"
   by (rule bchoice)
  then obtain R where E: "âˆ€X âˆˆ A. ?T (R X) X" ..
  have "xs âˆˆ Domain (seq_comp_failures P Q)"
  proof (simp add: Domain_iff)
    have "(xs, X') âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     using C and D ..
    thus "âˆƒX. (xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" ..
  qed
  moreover have "?T (Î»n. â‹ƒX âˆˆ A. R X n) (â‹ƒX âˆˆ A. X)"
  proof (rule conjI, rule_tac [2] conjI)
    show "(â‹ƒX âˆˆ A. X) = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ â‹ƒX âˆˆ A. R X n. W)"
    proof (rule equalityI, rule_tac [!] subsetI, simp_all,
     erule bexE, (erule_tac [2] bexE)+)
      fix x X
      assume F: "X âˆˆ A"
      hence "X = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R X n. W)"
       using E by simp
      moreover assume "x âˆˆ X"
      ultimately have "x âˆˆ (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R X n. W)"
       by simp
      hence "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. âˆƒW âˆˆ R X n. x âˆˆ W"
       by simp
      hence "âˆƒX âˆˆ A. âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. âˆƒW âˆˆ R X n. x âˆˆ W"
       using F ..
      thus "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. âˆƒX âˆˆ A. âˆƒW âˆˆ R X n. x âˆˆ W"
       by blast
    next
      fix x n X W
      assume F: "X âˆˆ A"
      hence G: "X = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R X n. W)"
       using E by simp
      assume "x âˆˆ W" and "W âˆˆ R X n"
      hence "âˆƒW âˆˆ R X n. x âˆˆ W" ..
      moreover assume "n âˆˆ {..length xs}"
      ultimately have "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. âˆƒW âˆˆ R X n. x âˆˆ W" ..
      hence "x âˆˆ (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length xs}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R X n. W)"
       by simp
      hence "x âˆˆ X"
       by (subst G)
      thus "âˆƒX âˆˆ A. x âˆˆ X"
       using F ..
    qed
  next
    show "âˆ€W âˆˆ â‹ƒX âˆˆ A. R X 0.
      xs âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ (xs, W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs, U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
        W = insert None U âˆ© V)"
      (is "âˆ€W âˆˆ _. ?T W")
    proof (rule ballI, simp only: UN_iff, erule bexE)
      fix W X
      assume "X âˆˆ A"
      hence "âˆ€W âˆˆ R X 0. ?T W"
       using E by simp
      moreover assume "W âˆˆ R X 0"
      ultimately show "?T W" ..
    qed
  next
    show "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}. âˆ€W âˆˆ â‹ƒX âˆˆ A. R X n.
      take (length xs - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length xs - n) xs, W) âˆˆ failures Q"
      (is "âˆ€n âˆˆ _. âˆ€W âˆˆ _. ?T n W")
    proof ((rule ballI)+, simp only: UN_iff, erule bexE)
      fix n W X
      assume "X âˆˆ A"
      hence "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R X n. ?T n W"
       using E by simp
      moreover assume "n âˆˆ {0<..length xs}"
      ultimately have "âˆ€W âˆˆ R X n. ?T n W" ..
      moreover assume "W âˆˆ R X n"
      ultimately show "?T n W" ..
    qed
  qed
  ultimately show "(xs, â‹ƒX âˆˆ A. X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_refusals_2 [OF A B])
qed

lemma seq_comp_weakly_sequential:
  assumes
    A: "weakly_sequential P" and
    B: "weakly_sequential Q"
  shows "weakly_sequential (P ; Q)"
proof (subst weakly_sequential_def, rule ballI, drule traces_failures,
 subst (asm) seq_comp_failures [OF A], erule seq_comp_failures.induct, simp_all)
  fix xs :: "'a option list"
  assume C: "None âˆ‰ set xs"
  show "None âˆ‰ set (butlast xs)"
  proof
    assume "None âˆˆ set (butlast xs)"
    hence "None âˆˆ set xs"
     by (rule in_set_butlastD)
    thus False
     using C by contradiction
  qed
next
  fix xs
  assume "xs âˆˆ sentences P"
  with A have C: "None âˆ‰ set xs"
   by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
  show "None âˆ‰ set (butlast xs)"
  proof
    assume "None âˆˆ set (butlast xs)"
    hence "None âˆˆ set xs"
     by (rule in_set_butlastD)
    thus False
     using C by contradiction
  qed
next
  fix xs ys Y
  assume "xs âˆˆ sentences P"
  with A have C: "None âˆ‰ set xs"
   by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
  have "âˆ€xs âˆˆ traces Q. None âˆ‰ set (butlast xs)"
   using B by (simp add: weakly_sequential_def)
  moreover assume "(ys, Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
  hence "ys âˆˆ traces Q"
   by (rule failures_traces)
  ultimately have "None âˆ‰ set (butlast ys)" ..
  hence "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ butlast ys)"
   using C by simp
  moreover assume "ys â‰  []"
  hence "butlast (xs @ ys) = xs @ butlast ys"
   by (simp add: butlast_append)
  ultimately show "None âˆ‰ set (butlast (xs @ ys))"
   by simp
qed

lemma seq_comp_sequential:
  assumes
    A: "sequential P" and
    B: "sequential Q"
  shows "sequential (P ; Q)"
proof (subst sequential_def, rule conjI)
  have "weakly_sequential P"
   using A by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
  moreover have "weakly_sequential Q"
   using B by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
  ultimately have "weakly_sequential (P ; Q)"
   by (rule seq_comp_weakly_sequential)
  thus "âˆ€xs âˆˆ traces (P ; Q). None âˆ‰ set (butlast xs)"
   by (simp add: weakly_sequential_def)
next
  have C: "weakly_sequential P"
   using A by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
  show "âˆ€xs âˆˆ sentences (P ; Q). next_events (P ; Q) xs = {None}"
  proof (rule ballI, simp add: sentences_def next_events_def, rule equalityI,
   rule_tac [!] subsetI, simp_all, (drule traces_failures)+,
   simp add: seq_comp_failures [OF C])
    fix xs x
    assume
      D: "(xs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
      E: "(xs @ [x], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
    have "âˆƒR. {} = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [None])}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
      (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
        xs @ [None] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§
          None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [None]) âˆ§ (xs @ [None], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
        xs @ [None] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
          (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [None], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
            W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
      (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [None])}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
        take (length (xs @ [None]) - n) (xs @ [None]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
        (drop (length (xs @ [None]) - n) (xs @ [None]), W) âˆˆ failures Q) âˆ§
      (âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [None])}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n)"
      (is "âˆƒR. ?T R")
     using D by (rule seq_comp_refusals_1)
    then obtain R where F: "?T R" ..
    hence "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..Suc (length xs)}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n"
     by simp
    moreover have "R 0 = {}"
    proof (rule equals0I)
      fix W
      assume "W âˆˆ R 0"
      hence "xs @ [None] âˆˆ sentences P"
       using F by simp
      with C have "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [None])"
       by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
      thus False
       by simp
    qed
    ultimately have "âˆƒn âˆˆ {0<..Suc (length xs)}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n"
    proof -
      assume "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..Suc (length xs)}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n"
      then obtain n where G: "n âˆˆ {..Suc (length xs)}" and H: "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n" ..
      assume I: "R 0 = {}"
      show "âˆƒn âˆˆ {0<..Suc (length xs)}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n"
      proof (cases n)
        case 0
        hence "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0"
         using H by simp
        then obtain W where "W âˆˆ R 0" ..
        moreover have "W âˆ‰ R 0"
         using I by (rule equals0D)
        ultimately show ?thesis
         by contradiction
      next
        case (Suc m)
        hence "n âˆˆ {0<..Suc (length xs)}"
         using G by simp
        with H show ?thesis ..
      qed
    qed
    then obtain n and W where G: "n âˆˆ {0<..Suc (length xs)}" and "W âˆˆ R n"
     by blast
    hence
     "take (Suc (length xs) - n) (xs @ [None]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (Suc (length xs) - n) (xs @ [None]), W) âˆˆ failures Q"
     using F by simp
    moreover have H: "Suc (length xs) - n â‰¤ length xs"
     using G by (simp, arith)
    ultimately have I:
     "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [None], W) âˆˆ failures Q"
     by simp
    have "âˆƒR. {} = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [x])}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
      (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
        xs @ [x] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§
          None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [x]) âˆ§ (xs @ [x], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
        xs @ [x] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
          (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [x], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
            W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
      (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [x])}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
        take (length (xs @ [x]) - n) (xs @ [x]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
        (drop (length (xs @ [x]) - n) (xs @ [x]), W) âˆˆ failures Q) âˆ§
      (âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [x])}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n)"
      (is "âˆƒR. ?T R")
     using E by (rule seq_comp_refusals_1)
    then obtain R' where J: "?T R'" ..
    hence "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..Suc (length xs)}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R' n"
     by simp
    then obtain n' where K: "n' âˆˆ {..Suc (length xs)}" and L: "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R' n'" ..
    have "n' = 0 âˆ¨ n' âˆˆ {0<..Suc (length xs)}"
     using K by auto
    thus "x = None"
    proof
      assume "n' = 0"
      hence "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R' 0"
       using L by simp
      then obtain W' where "W' âˆˆ R' 0" ..
      hence
       "xs @ [x] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§
          None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [x]) âˆ§ (xs @ [x], W') âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
        xs @ [x] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
          (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [x], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
            W' = insert None U âˆ© V)"
       using J by simp
      hence M: "xs @ [x] âˆˆ traces P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [x])"
      proof (cases "xs @ [x] âˆˆ sentences P", simp_all, (erule_tac [2] conjE)+,
       simp_all)
        case False
        assume "(xs @ [x], W') âˆˆ failures P"
        thus "xs @ [x] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule failures_traces)
      next
        case True
        hence "(xs @ [x]) @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (simp add: sentences_def)
        hence "xs @ [x] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule process_rule_2_traces)
        moreover have "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [x])"
         using C and True by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
        ultimately show "xs @ [x] âˆˆ traces P âˆ§ None â‰  x âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs"
         by simp
      qed
      have "xs @ [x] = take (Suc (length xs) - n) (xs @ [x]) @
        drop (Suc (length xs) - n) (xs @ [x])"
       by (simp only: append_take_drop_id)
      hence "xs @ [x] = take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @
        drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [x]"
       using H by simp
      moreover have "âˆƒy ys. drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [x] = y # ys"
       by (cases "drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [x]", simp_all)
      then obtain y and ys where "drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [x] = y # ys"
       by blast
      ultimately have N: "xs @ [x] = take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ y # ys"
       by simp
      have "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P"
       using I ..
      moreover have "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ y # ys âˆˆ traces P"
       using M and N by simp
      ultimately have "y = None"
       by (rule seq_sentences_none [OF A])
      moreover have "y â‰  None"
       using M and N by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
      ultimately show ?thesis
       by contradiction
    next
      assume M: "n' âˆˆ {0<..Suc (length xs)}"
      moreover obtain W' where "W' âˆˆ R' n'"
       using L ..
      ultimately have
       "take (Suc (length xs) - n') (xs @ [x]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
        (drop (Suc (length xs) - n') (xs @ [x]), W') âˆˆ failures Q"
       using J by simp
      moreover have N: "Suc (length xs) - n' â‰¤ length xs"
       using M by (simp, arith)
      ultimately have O:
       "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
        (drop (Suc (length xs) - n') xs @ [x], W') âˆˆ failures Q"
       by simp
      moreover have "n = n'"
      proof (rule ccontr, simp add: neq_iff, erule disjE)
        assume P: "n < n'"
        have "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n') (take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs) @
          drop (Suc (length xs) - n') (take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs)"
         by (simp only: append_take_drop_id)
        also have "â€¦ =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs @
          drop (Suc (length xs) - n') (take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs)"
         using P by (simp add: min_def)
        also have "â€¦ =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs @
          take (n' - n) (drop (Suc (length xs) - n') xs)"
         using M by (subst drop_take, simp)
        finally have "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs @
          take (n' - n) (drop (Suc (length xs) - n') xs)" .
        moreover have "take (n' - n) (drop (Suc (length xs) - n') xs) â‰  []"
        proof (rule_tac notI, simp, erule disjE)
          assume "n' â‰¤ n"
          thus False
           using P by simp
        next
          assume "length xs â‰¤ Suc (length xs) - n'"
          moreover have "Suc (length xs) - n' < Suc (length xs) - n"
           using M and P by simp
          hence "Suc (length xs) - n' < length xs"
           using H by simp
          ultimately show False
           by simp
        qed
        hence "âˆƒy ys. take (n' - n) (drop (Suc (length xs) - n') xs) = y # ys"
         by (cases "take (n' - n) (drop (Suc (length xs) - n') xs)", simp_all)
        then obtain y and ys where
         "take (n' - n) (drop (Suc (length xs) - n') xs) = y # ys"
         by blast
        ultimately have Q: "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs @ y # ys"
         by simp
        have "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs âˆˆ sentences P"
         using O ..
        moreover have R: "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P"
         using I ..
        hence "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (simp add: sentences_def)
        hence "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule process_rule_2_traces)
        hence "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs @ y # ys âˆˆ traces P"
         using Q by simp
        ultimately have "y = None"
         by (rule seq_sentences_none [OF A])
        moreover have "None âˆ‰ set (take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs)"
         using C and R by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
        hence "y â‰  None"
         using Q by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
        ultimately show False
         by contradiction
      next
        assume P: "n' < n"
        have "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n) (take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs) @
          drop (Suc (length xs) - n) (take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs)"
         by (simp only: append_take_drop_id)
        also have "â€¦ =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @
          drop (Suc (length xs) - n) (take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs)"
         using P by (simp add: min_def)
        also have "â€¦ =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @
          take (n - n') (drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs)"
         using G by (subst drop_take, simp)
        finally have "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @
          take (n - n') (drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs)" .
        moreover have "take (n - n') (drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs) â‰  []"
        proof (rule_tac notI, simp, erule disjE)
          assume "n â‰¤ n'"
          thus False
           using P by simp
        next
          assume "length xs â‰¤ Suc (length xs) - n"
          moreover have "Suc (length xs) - n < Suc (length xs) - n'"
           using G and P by simp
          hence "Suc (length xs) - n < length xs"
           using N by simp
          ultimately show False
           by simp
        qed
        hence "âˆƒy ys. take (n - n') (drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs) = y # ys"
         by (cases "take (n - n') (drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs)", simp_all)
        then obtain y and ys where
         "take (n - n') (drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs) = y # ys"
         by blast
        ultimately have Q: "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs =
          take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ y # ys"
         by simp
        have "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs âˆˆ sentences P"
         using I ..
        moreover have R: "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs âˆˆ sentences P"
         using O ..
        hence "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (simp add: sentences_def)
        hence "take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule process_rule_2_traces)
        hence "take (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ y # ys âˆˆ traces P"
         using Q by simp
        ultimately have "y = None"
         by (rule seq_sentences_none [OF A])
        moreover have "None âˆ‰ set (take (Suc (length xs) - n') xs)"
         using C and R by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
        hence "y â‰  None"
         using Q by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
        ultimately show False
         by contradiction
      qed
      ultimately have "(drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [x], W') âˆˆ failures Q"
       by simp
      hence P: "drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [x] âˆˆ traces Q"
       by (rule failures_traces)
      have "(drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [None], W) âˆˆ failures Q"
       using I ..
      hence "drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs @ [None] âˆˆ traces Q"
       by (rule failures_traces)
      hence "drop (Suc (length xs) - n) xs âˆˆ sentences Q"
       by (simp add: sentences_def)
      with B show ?thesis
       using P by (rule seq_sentences_none)
    qed
  qed
qed


subsection "Conservation of noninterference security under sequential composition"

text â€¹
Everything is now ready for proving the target security conservation theorem. The two closure
properties that the definition of noninterference security requires process futures to satisfy, one
for the addition of events into traces and the other for the deletion of events from traces (cf.
\cite{R2}), will be faced separately; here below is the proof of the former property.
Unsurprisingly, rule induction on set @{term seq_comp_failures} is applied, and the closure of the
failures of a secure process under intransitive purge (proven in the previous section) is used to
meet the proof obligations arising from rule â€¹SCF_R3â€º.

\null
â€º

lemma seq_comp_secure_aux_1_case_1:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "sequential P" and
    C: "secure P I D" and
    D: "xs @ y # ys âˆ‰ sentences P" and
    E: "(xs @ y # ys, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    F: "None â‰  y" and
    G: "None âˆ‰ set xs" and
    H: "None âˆ‰ set ys"
  shows "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof -
  have "(y # ys, X) âˆˆ futures P xs"
   using E by (simp add: futures_def)
  hence "(ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X) âˆˆ
    futures P xs"
   using C by (simp add: secure_def)
  hence I: "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X) âˆˆ
    failures P"
   by (simp add: futures_def)
  show ?thesis
  proof (cases "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆˆ sentences P",
   cases "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨ (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)",
   simp_all)
    assume "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆ‰ sentences P"
    thus ?thesis using I
    proof (rule SCF_R1, simp add: F G)
      have "set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys) âŠ† set ys"
       by (rule ipurge_tr_set)
      thus "None âˆ‰ set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys)"
       using H by (rule contra_subsetD)
    qed
  next
    assume
      J: "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆˆ sentences P" and
      K: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨ (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)"
    have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X = {}"
    proof (rule disjE [OF K], erule_tac [2] bexE)
      assume L: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I"
      show ?thesis
      proof (rule ipurge_ref_empty [of "D y"], simp)
        fix x
        have "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I)"
         using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
        hence "âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I"
         using F and L by simp
        thus "(D y, D x) âˆˆ I"
         by simp
      qed
    next
      fix u
      assume
        L: "u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys" and
        M: "(u, D None) âˆˆ I"
      have "âˆƒy' âˆˆ set ys. u = D y'"
       using L by (rule sinks_elem)
      then obtain y' where N: "y' âˆˆ set ys" and O: "u = D y'" ..
      have P: "y' â‰  None"
      proof
        assume "y' = None"
        hence "None âˆˆ set ys"
         using N by simp
        thus False
         using H by contradiction
      qed
      show ?thesis
      proof (rule ipurge_ref_empty [of u], simp add: L)
        fix x
        have "(D y', D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y' â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D y', v) âˆˆ I)"
         using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
        moreover have "(D y', D None) âˆˆ I"
         using M and O by simp
        ultimately have "âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D y', v) âˆˆ I"
         using P by simp
        thus "(u, D x) âˆˆ I"
         using O by simp
      qed
    qed
    thus ?thesis
    proof simp
      have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
       by (rule process_rule_1)
      with J and I have "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys,
        insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X) âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R2)
      thus "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by simp
    qed
  next
    assume
      J: "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆˆ sentences P" and
      K: "(D y, D None) âˆ‰ I âˆ§ (âˆ€u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys. (u, D None) âˆ‰ I)"
    have "(xs @ [y]) @ ys âˆˆ sentences P"
    proof (simp add: sentences_def del: append_assoc, subst (2) append_assoc,
     rule ipurge_tr_del_traces [OF C, where u = "D y"], simp_all add: K)
      have "(y # ys, X) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       using E by (simp add: futures_def)
      moreover have "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
       using J by (simp add: sentences_def)
      hence "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule traces_failures)
      hence "(ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       by (simp add: futures_def)
      ultimately have "(y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None]),
        ipurge_ref I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None]) {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       using C by (simp add: secure_def del: ipurge_tr.simps)
      hence "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None]), {})
        âˆˆ failures P"
       by (simp add: futures_def ipurge_ref_def)
      moreover have "sinks I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys) = {}"
       by (rule sinks_idem)
      hence "Â¬ ((D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
        (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys). (u, D None) âˆˆ I))"
       using K by simp
      hence "D None âˆ‰ sinks I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None])"
       by (simp only: sinks_interference_eq, simp)
      ultimately have "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys)
        @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by simp
      hence "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (simp add: ipurge_tr_idem)
      thus "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
       by (rule failures_traces)
    next
      show "xs @ y # ys âˆˆ traces P"
       using E by (rule failures_traces)
    qed
    hence "xs @ y # ys âˆˆ sentences P"
     by simp
    thus ?thesis
     using D by contradiction
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_secure_aux_1_case_2:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "sequential P" and
    C: "secure P I D" and
    D: "secure Q I D" and
    E: "xs @ y # ys âˆˆ sentences P" and
    F: "(xs @ y # ys, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    G: "([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
  shows "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys,
    ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys (insert None X âˆ© Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof -
  have "(y # ys, X) âˆˆ futures P xs"
   using F by (simp add: futures_def)
  hence "(ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X)
    âˆˆ futures P xs"
   using C by (simp add: secure_def)
  hence H: "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X)
    âˆˆ failures P"
   by (simp add: futures_def)
  have "weakly_sequential P"
   using B by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
  hence I: "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ y # ys)"
   using E by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
  show ?thesis
  proof (cases "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆˆ sentences P",
   case_tac [2] "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨ (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)",
   simp_all)
    assume J: "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆˆ sentences P"
    have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y âŠ† Y"
     by (rule ipurge_ref_subset)
    with G have "([], ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
     by (rule process_rule_3)
    with J and H have "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys,
      insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X) âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by (rule SCF_R2)
    moreover have
     "ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys (insert None X) âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y âŠ†
      insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X) âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y"
    proof (rule subsetI, simp del: insert_iff, erule conjE)
      fix x
      have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys (insert None X) âŠ†
        insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X)"
       by (rule ipurge_ref_subset_insert)
      moreover assume "x âˆˆ ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys (insert None X)"
      ultimately show "x âˆˆ insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X)" ..
    qed
    ultimately have "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys,
      ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys (insert None X) âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by (rule seq_comp_prop_3)
    thus ?thesis
     by (simp add: ipurge_ref_distrib_inter)
  next
    assume
      J: "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆ‰ sentences P" and
      K: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨ (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)"
    have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys (insert None X âˆ© Y) = {}"
    proof (rule disjE [OF K], erule_tac [2] bexE)
      assume L: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I"
      show ?thesis
      proof (rule ipurge_ref_empty [of "D y"], simp)
        fix x
        have "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I)"
         using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
        moreover have "y â‰  None"
         using I by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
        ultimately have "âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I"
         using L by simp
        thus "(D y, D x) âˆˆ I"
         by simp
      qed
    next
      fix u
      assume
        L: "u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys" and
        M: "(u, D None) âˆˆ I"
      have "âˆƒy' âˆˆ set ys. u = D y'"
       using L by (rule sinks_elem)
      then obtain y' where N: "y' âˆˆ set ys" and O: "u = D y'" ..
      have P: "y' â‰  None"
      proof
        assume "y' = None"
        hence "None âˆˆ set ys"
         using N by simp
        moreover have "None âˆ‰ set ys"
         using I by simp
        ultimately show False
         by contradiction
      qed
      show ?thesis
      proof (rule ipurge_ref_empty [of u], simp add: L)
        fix x
        have "(D y', D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y' â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D y', v) âˆˆ I)"
         using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
        moreover have "(D y', D None) âˆˆ I"
         using M and O by simp
        ultimately have "âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D y', v) âˆˆ I"
         using P by simp
        thus "(u, D x) âˆˆ I"
         using O by simp
      qed
    qed
    thus ?thesis
    proof simp
      have "{} âŠ† ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X" ..
      with H have "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule process_rule_3)
      with J show "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
      proof (rule SCF_R1)
        show "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys)"
         using I
        proof (simp, (erule_tac conjE)+)
          have "set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys) âŠ† set ys"
           by (rule ipurge_tr_set)
          moreover assume "None âˆ‰ set ys"
          ultimately show "None âˆ‰ set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys)"
           by (rule contra_subsetD)
        qed
      qed
    qed
  next
    assume
      J: "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆ‰ sentences P" and
      K: "(D y, D None) âˆ‰ I âˆ§ (âˆ€u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys. (u, D None) âˆ‰ I)"
    have "xs @ y # ys @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
     using E by (simp add: sentences_def)
    hence "(xs @ y # ys @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
     by (rule traces_failures)
    hence "(y # ys @ [None], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
     by (simp add: futures_def)
    hence "(ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ys @ [None]),
      ipurge_ref I D (D y) (ys @ [None]) {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
      (is "(_, ?Y) âˆˆ _")
     using C by (simp add: secure_def del: ipurge_tr.simps)
    hence "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ys @ [None]), ?Y) âˆˆ failures P"
     by (simp add: futures_def)
    hence "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ys @ [None]) âˆˆ traces P"
     by (rule failures_traces)
    moreover have "Â¬ ((D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
      (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ys. (u, D None) âˆˆ I))"
     using K by simp
    hence "D None âˆ‰ sinks I D (D y) (ys @ [None])"
     by (simp only: sinks_interference_eq, simp)
    ultimately have "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
     by simp
    hence "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys âˆˆ sentences P"
     by (simp add: sentences_def)
    thus ?thesis
     using J by contradiction
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_secure_aux_1_case_3:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "ref_union_closed Q" and
    C: "sequential Q" and
    D: "secure Q I D" and
    E: "secure R I D" and
    F: "ws âˆˆ sentences Q" and
    G: "(ys', Y) âˆˆ failures R" and
    H: "ws @ ys' = xs @ y # ys"
  shows "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
proof (cases "length xs < length ws")
  case True
  have "drop (Suc (length xs)) (xs @ y # ys) = drop (Suc (length xs)) (ws @ ys')"
   using H by simp
  hence I: "ys = drop (Suc (length xs)) ws @ ys'"
    (is "_ = ?ws' @ _")
   using True by simp
  let ?U = "insert (D y) (sinks I D (D y) ?ws')"
  have "ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys =
    ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys'"
   using I by (simp add: ipurge_tr_append)
  moreover have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y = ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y"
   using I by (simp add: ipurge_ref_append)
  ultimately show ?thesis
  proof (cases "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' âˆˆ sentences Q", simp_all)
    assume J: "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' âˆˆ sentences Q"
    have K: "(ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys', ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y) âˆˆ failures R"
     using E and G by (rule ipurge_tr_ref_aux_failures)
    show "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys',
      ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
    proof (cases "ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys'")
      case Nil
      have "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws', {x. x â‰  None}) âˆˆ failures Q"
       using B and C and J by (rule seq_sentences_ref)
      moreover have "([], ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y) âˆˆ failures R"
       using K and Nil by simp
      ultimately have "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws',
        insert None {x. x â‰  None} âˆ© ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y)
        âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
       by (rule SCF_R2 [OF J])
      moreover have "insert None {x. x â‰  None} âˆ©
        ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y = ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y"
       by blast
      ultimately show ?thesis
       using Nil by simp
    next
      case Cons
      hence "ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys' â‰  []"
       by simp
      with J and K have
       "((xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws') @ ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys',
          ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
       by (rule SCF_R3)
      thus ?thesis
       by simp
    qed
  next
    assume J: "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' âˆ‰ sentences Q"
    have "ws = take (Suc (length xs)) ws @ ?ws'"
     by simp
    moreover have "take (Suc (length xs)) (ws @ ys') =
      take (Suc (length xs)) (xs @ y # ys)"
     using H by simp
    hence "take (Suc (length xs)) ws = xs @ [y]"
     using True by simp
    ultimately have K: "xs @ y # ?ws' âˆˆ sentences Q"
     using F by simp
    hence "xs @ y # ?ws' @ [None] âˆˆ traces Q"
     by (simp add: sentences_def)
    hence "(xs @ y # ?ws' @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
     by (rule traces_failures)
    hence "(y # ?ws' @ [None], {}) âˆˆ futures Q xs"
     by (simp add: futures_def)
    hence "(ipurge_tr I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None]),
      ipurge_ref I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None]) {}) âˆˆ futures Q xs"
     using D by (simp add: secure_def del: ipurge_tr.simps)
    hence L: "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None]), {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
     by (simp add: futures_def ipurge_ref_def)
    have "weakly_sequential Q"
     using C by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
    hence N: "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ y # ?ws')"
     using K by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
    show "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys',
      ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
    proof (cases "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
     (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)")
      assume M: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
        (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)"
      have "ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys' = []"
      proof (rule disjE [OF M], erule_tac [2] bexE)
        assume O: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I"
        show ?thesis
        proof (rule ipurge_tr_aux_nil [of "D y"], simp)
          fix x
          have "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I)"
           using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
          moreover have "y â‰  None"
           using N by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
          ultimately have "âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I"
           using O by simp
          thus "(D y, D x) âˆˆ I"
           by simp
        qed
      next
        fix u
        assume
          O: "u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'" and
          P: "(u, D None) âˆˆ I"
        have "âˆƒw âˆˆ set ?ws'. u = D w"
         using O by (rule sinks_elem)
        then obtain w where Q: "w âˆˆ set ?ws'" and R: "u = D w" ..
        have S: "w â‰  None"
        proof
          assume "w = None"
          hence "None âˆˆ set ?ws'"
           using Q by simp
          moreover have "None âˆ‰ set ?ws'"
           using N by simp
          ultimately show False
           by contradiction
        qed
        show ?thesis
        proof (rule ipurge_tr_aux_nil [of u], simp add: O)
          fix x
          have "(D w, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ w â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D w, v) âˆˆ I)"
           using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
          moreover have "(D w, D None) âˆˆ I"
           using P and R by simp
          ultimately have "âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D w, v) âˆˆ I"
           using S by simp
          thus "(u, D x) âˆˆ I"
           using R by simp
        qed
      qed
      moreover have "ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys' Y = {}"
      proof (rule disjE [OF M], erule_tac [2] bexE)
        assume O: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I"
        show ?thesis
        proof (rule ipurge_ref_aux_empty [of "D y"])
          have "?U âŠ† sinks_aux I D ?U ys'"
           by (rule sinks_aux_subset)
          moreover have "D y âˆˆ ?U"
           by simp
          ultimately show "D y âˆˆ sinks_aux I D ?U ys'" ..
        next
          fix x
          have "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I)"
           using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
          moreover have "y â‰  None"
           using N by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
          ultimately have "âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I"
           using O by simp
          thus "(D y, D x) âˆˆ I"
           by simp
        qed
      next
        fix u
        assume
          O: "u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'" and
          P: "(u, D None) âˆˆ I"
        have "âˆƒw âˆˆ set ?ws'. u = D w"
         using O by (rule sinks_elem)
        then obtain w where Q: "w âˆˆ set ?ws'" and R: "u = D w" ..
        have S: "w â‰  None"
        proof
          assume "w = None"
          hence "None âˆˆ set ?ws'"
           using Q by simp
          moreover have "None âˆ‰ set ?ws'"
           using N by simp
          ultimately show False
           by contradiction
        qed
        show ?thesis
        proof (rule ipurge_ref_aux_empty [of u])
          have "?U âŠ† sinks_aux I D ?U ys'"
           by (rule sinks_aux_subset)
          moreover have "u âˆˆ ?U"
           using O by simp
          ultimately show "u âˆˆ sinks_aux I D ?U ys'" ..
        next
          fix x
          have "(D w, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ w â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D w, v) âˆˆ I)"
           using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
          moreover have "(D w, D None) âˆˆ I"
           using P and R by simp
          ultimately have "âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D w, v) âˆˆ I"
           using S by simp
          thus "(u, D x) âˆˆ I"
           using R by simp
        qed
      qed
      ultimately show ?thesis
      proof simp
        have "D None âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None])"
         using M by (simp only: sinks_interference_eq)
        hence "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws', {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
         using L by simp
        moreover have "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws')"
        proof -
          show ?thesis
           using N
          proof (simp, (erule_tac conjE)+)
            have "set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws') âŠ† set ?ws'"
             by (rule ipurge_tr_set)
            moreover assume "None âˆ‰ set ?ws'"
            ultimately show "None âˆ‰ set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws')"
             by (rule contra_subsetD)
          qed
        qed
        ultimately show "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws', {})
          âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
         by (rule SCF_R1 [OF J])
      qed
    next
      assume "Â¬ ((D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
        (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'. (u, D None) âˆˆ I))"
      hence "D None âˆ‰ sinks I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None])"
       by (simp only: sinks_interference_eq, simp)
      hence "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
       using L by simp
      hence "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ [None] âˆˆ traces Q"
       by (rule failures_traces)
      hence "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' âˆˆ sentences Q"
       by (simp add: sentences_def)
      thus ?thesis
       using J by contradiction
    qed
  qed
next
  case False
  have "drop (length ws) (ws @ ys') = drop (length ws) (xs @ y # ys)"
   using H by simp
  hence "ys' = drop (length ws) xs @ y # ys"
    (is "_ = ?xs' @ _")
   using False by simp
  hence "(?xs' @ y # ys, Y) âˆˆ failures R"
   using G by simp
  hence "(y # ys, Y) âˆˆ futures R ?xs'"
   by (simp add: futures_def)
  hence "(ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
    âˆˆ futures R ?xs'"
   using E by (simp add: secure_def)
  hence I: "(?xs' @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
    âˆˆ failures R"
   by (simp add: futures_def)
  have "xs = take (length ws) xs @ ?xs'"
   by simp
  hence "xs = take (length ws) (xs @ y # ys) @ ?xs'"
   using False by simp
  hence "xs = take (length ws) (ws @ ys') @ ?xs'"
   using H by simp
  hence J: "xs = ws @ ?xs'"
   by simp
  show ?thesis
  proof (cases "?xs' @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys = []", insert I, subst J, simp)
    have "(ws, {x. x â‰  None}) âˆˆ failures Q"
     using B and C and F by (rule seq_sentences_ref)
    moreover assume "([], ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y) âˆˆ failures R"
    ultimately have "(ws, insert None {x. x â‰  None} âˆ©
      ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
     by (rule SCF_R2 [OF F])
    moreover have "insert None {x. x â‰  None} âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y =
      ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y"
     by blast
    ultimately show "(ws, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
     by simp
  next
    assume "?xs' @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys â‰  []"
    with F and I have
     "(ws @ ?xs' @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
     by (rule SCF_R3)
    hence "((ws @ ?xs') @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Q R"
     by simp
    thus ?thesis
     using J by simp
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_secure_aux_1 [rule_format]:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "ref_union_closed P" and
    C: "sequential P" and
    D: "secure P I D" and
    E: "secure Q I D"
  shows "(ws, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹
    ws = xs @ y # ys âŸ¶
    (xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof (erule seq_comp_failures.induct, rule_tac [!] impI, simp_all, (erule conjE)+)
  fix X
  assume
   "xs @ y # ys âˆ‰ sentences P" and
   "(xs @ y # ys, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
   "None â‰  y" and
   "None âˆ‰ set xs" and
   "None âˆ‰ set ys"
  thus "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_secure_aux_1_case_1 [OF A C D])
next
  fix X Y
  assume
   "xs @ y # ys âˆˆ sentences P" and
   "(xs @ y # ys, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
   "([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
  thus "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys,
    ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys (insert None X âˆ© Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_secure_aux_1_case_2 [OF A C D E])
next
  fix ws ys' Y
  assume
   "ws âˆˆ sentences P" and
   "(ys', Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
   "ws @ ys' = xs @ y # ys"
  thus "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_secure_aux_1_case_3 [OF A B C D E])
next
  fix X Y
  assume
   "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
   "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  hence "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys,
    ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys X âˆª ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule SCF_R4)
  thus "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys (X âˆª Y))
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (simp add: ipurge_ref_distrib_union)
qed

lemma seq_comp_secure_1:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "ref_union_closed P" and
    C: "sequential P" and
    D: "secure P I D" and
    E: "secure Q I D"
  shows "(xs @ y # ys, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹
    (xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
by (rule seq_comp_secure_aux_1 [OF A B C D E, where ws = "xs @ y # ys"],
 simp_all)

text â€¹
\null

This completes the proof that the former requirement for noninterference security is satisfied, so
it is the turn of the latter one. Again, rule induction on set @{term seq_comp_failures} is applied,
and the closure of the failures of a secure process under intransitive purge is used to meet the
proof obligations arising from rule â€¹SCF_R3â€º. In more detail, rule induction is applied to the
trace into which the event is inserted, and then a case distinction is performed on the trace from
which the event is extracted, using the expression of its refusal as union of a set of refusals
derived previously.

\null
â€º

lemma seq_comp_secure_aux_2_case_1:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "sequential P" and
    C: "secure P I D" and
    D: "xs @ zs âˆ‰ sentences P" and
    E: "(xs @ zs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    F: "None âˆ‰ set xs" and
    G: "None âˆ‰ set zs" and
    H: "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  shows "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof -
  have "âˆƒR. {} = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
    (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      xs @ [y] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y]) âˆ§
        (xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§
        ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§ W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
    (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
      take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]), W) âˆˆ failures Q) âˆ§
    (âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n)"
    (is "âˆƒR. ?T R")
   using H by (rule seq_comp_refusals_1)
  then obtain R where I: "?T R" ..
  hence "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n"
   by simp
  moreover have "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}. R n = {}"
  proof (rule ballI, rule equals0I)
    fix n W
    assume J: "n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}"
    hence "âˆ€W âˆˆ R n. take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P"
     using I by simp
    moreover assume "W âˆˆ R n"
    ultimately have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P" ..
    moreover have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) =
      take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)"
     using J by simp
    ultimately have K: "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) âˆˆ sentences P"
     by simp
    show False
    proof (cases "drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)")
      case Nil
      hence "xs @ zs âˆˆ sentences P"
       using K by simp
      thus False
       using D by contradiction
    next
      case (Cons v vs)
      moreover have "xs @ zs = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @
        drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)"
       by (simp only: append_take_drop_id)
      ultimately have L: "xs @ zs =
        take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ v # vs"
       by (simp del: take_append)
      hence "(take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ v # vs, X)
        âˆˆ failures P"
       using E by (simp del: take_append)
      hence "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ v # vs âˆˆ traces P"
       by (rule failures_traces)
      with B and K have "v = None"
       by (rule seq_sentences_none)
      moreover have "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ zs)"
       using F and G by simp
      hence "None âˆ‰ set (take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ v # vs)"
       by (subst (asm) L)
      hence "v â‰  None"
       by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
      ultimately show False
       by contradiction
    qed
  qed
  ultimately have "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0"
  proof simp
    assume "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..Suc (length xs)}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n"
    then obtain n where J: "n âˆˆ {..Suc (length xs)}" and K: "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n" ..
    assume L: "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..Suc (length xs)}. R n = {}"
    show ?thesis
    proof (cases n)
      case 0
      thus ?thesis
       using K by simp
    next
      case (Suc m)
      obtain W where "W âˆˆ R n"
       using K ..
      moreover have "0 < n"
       using Suc by simp
      hence "n âˆˆ {0<..Suc (length xs)}"
       using J by simp
      with L have "R n = {}" ..
      hence "W âˆ‰ R n"
       by (rule equals0D)
      ultimately show ?thesis
       by contradiction
    qed
  qed
  then obtain W where J: "W âˆˆ R 0" ..
  have "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
    xs @ [y] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§
      None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y]) âˆ§ (xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
    xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
        W = insert None U âˆ© V)"
    (is "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0. ?T W")
   using I by simp
  hence "?T W" using J ..
  hence K: "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ None â‰  y"
  proof (cases "xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P", simp_all del: ex_simps,
   (erule_tac exE)+, (erule_tac [!] conjE)+, simp_all)
    case False
    assume "(xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P"
    moreover have "{} âŠ† W" ..
    ultimately show "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
     by (rule process_rule_3)
  next
    fix U
    case True
    assume "(xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P"
    moreover have "{} âŠ† U" ..
    ultimately have "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
     by (rule process_rule_3)
    moreover have "weakly_sequential P"
     using B by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
    hence "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y])"
     using True by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
    hence "None â‰  y"
     by simp
    ultimately show ?thesis ..
  qed
  have "(zs, X) âˆˆ futures P xs"
   using E by (simp add: futures_def)
  moreover have "([y], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
   using K by (simp add: futures_def)
  ultimately have "(y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X) âˆˆ
    futures P xs"
   using C by (simp add: secure_def)
  hence L: "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X) âˆˆ
    failures P"
   by (simp add: futures_def)
  show ?thesis
  proof (cases "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆˆ sentences P",
   cases "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨ (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)",
   simp_all)
    assume "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆ‰ sentences P"
    thus ?thesis using L
