    proof (rule SCF_R1, simp add: F K)
      have "set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs) âŠ† set zs"
       by (rule ipurge_tr_set)
      thus "None âˆ‰ set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs)"
       using G by (rule contra_subsetD)
    qed
  next
    assume
      M: "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆˆ sentences P" and
      N: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨ (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)"
    have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X = {}"
    proof (rule disjE [OF N], erule_tac [2] bexE)
      assume O: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I"
      show ?thesis
      proof (rule ipurge_ref_empty [of "D y"], simp)
        fix x
        have "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I)"
         using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
        moreover have "y â‰  None"
         using K by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
        ultimately have "âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I"
         using O by simp
        thus "(D y, D x) âˆˆ I"
         by simp
      qed
    next
      fix u
      assume
        O: "u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs" and
        P: "(u, D None) âˆˆ I"
      have "âˆƒz âˆˆ set zs. u = D z"
       using O by (rule sinks_elem)
      then obtain z where Q: "z âˆˆ set zs" and R: "u = D z" ..
      have S: "z â‰  None"
      proof
        assume "z = None"
        hence "None âˆˆ set zs"
         using Q by simp
        thus False
         using G by contradiction
      qed
      show ?thesis
      proof (rule ipurge_ref_empty [of u], simp add: O)
        fix x
        have "(D z, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ z â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D z, v) âˆˆ I)"
         using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
        moreover have "(D z, D None) âˆˆ I"
         using P and R by simp
        ultimately have "âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D z, v) âˆˆ I"
         using S by simp
        thus "(u, D x) âˆˆ I"
         using R by simp
      qed
    qed
    thus ?thesis
    proof simp
      have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
       by (rule process_rule_1)
      with M and L have "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs,
        insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X) âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R2)
      thus "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by simp
    qed
  next
    assume
      M: "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆˆ sentences P" and
      N: "(D y, D None) âˆ‰ I âˆ§ (âˆ€u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs. (u, D None) âˆ‰ I)"
    have "xs @ zs âˆˆ sentences P"
    proof (simp add: sentences_def,
     rule ipurge_tr_del_traces [OF C, where u = "D y"], simp add: N)
      have "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
       using M by (simp add: sentences_def)
      hence "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule traces_failures)
      hence "(y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       by (simp add: futures_def)
      hence "(ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None]),
        ipurge_ref I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None]) {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       using C by (simp add: secure_def del: ipurge_tr.simps)
      hence "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None]), {})
        âˆˆ failures P"
       by (simp add: futures_def ipurge_ref_def)
      moreover have "sinks I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs) = {}"
       by (rule sinks_idem)
      hence "Â¬ ((D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
        (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs). (u, D None) âˆˆ I))"
       using N by simp
      hence "D None âˆ‰ sinks I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None])"
       by (simp only: sinks_interference_eq, simp)
      ultimately have "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs)
        @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by simp
      hence "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (simp add: ipurge_tr_idem)
      thus "xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
       by (rule failures_traces)
    next
      show "xs @ zs âˆˆ traces P"
       using E by (rule failures_traces)
    qed
    thus ?thesis
     using D by contradiction
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_secure_aux_2_case_2:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "sequential P" and
    C: "secure P I D" and
    D: "secure Q I D" and
    E: "xs @ zs âˆˆ sentences P" and
    F: "(xs @ zs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
    G: "([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
    H: "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  shows "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs,
    ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs (insert None X âˆ© Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof -
  have "âˆƒR. {} = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
    (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      xs @ [y] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y]) âˆ§
        (xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§
        ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§ W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
    (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
      take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]), W) âˆˆ failures Q) âˆ§
    (âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n)"
    (is "âˆƒR. ?T R")
   using H by (rule seq_comp_refusals_1)
  then obtain R where I: "?T R" ..
  hence "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n"
   by simp
  then obtain n where J: "n âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}" and K: "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n" ..
  have "weakly_sequential P"
   using B by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
  hence L: "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ zs)"
   using E by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
  have "n = 0 âˆ¨ n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}"
   using J by auto
  thus ?thesis
  proof
    assume "n = 0"
    hence "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0"
     using K by simp
    then obtain W where M: "W âˆˆ R 0" ..
    have "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      xs @ [y] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§
        None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y]) âˆ§ (xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
        (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
          W = insert None U âˆ© V)"
      (is "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0. ?T W")
     using I by simp
    hence "?T W" using M ..
    hence N: "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ None â‰  y"
    proof (cases "xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P", simp_all del: ex_simps,
     (erule_tac exE)+, (erule_tac [!] conjE)+, simp_all)
      case False
      assume "(xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P"
      moreover have "{} âŠ† W" ..
      ultimately show "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule process_rule_3)
    next
      fix U
      case True
      assume "(xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P"
      moreover have "{} âŠ† U" ..
      ultimately have "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule process_rule_3)
      moreover have "weakly_sequential P"
       using B by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
      hence "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y])"
       using True by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
      hence "None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ None â‰  y"
       by simp
      ultimately show ?thesis ..
    qed
    have "(zs, X) âˆˆ futures P xs"
     using F by (simp add: futures_def)
    moreover have "([y], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
     using N by (simp add: futures_def)
    ultimately have "(y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X)
      âˆˆ futures P xs"
     using C by (simp add: secure_def)
    hence O: "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X)
      âˆˆ failures P"
     by (simp add: futures_def)
    show ?thesis
    proof (cases "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆˆ sentences P",
     case_tac [2] "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
      (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)",
     simp_all)
      assume P: "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆˆ sentences P"
      have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y âŠ† Y"
       by (rule ipurge_ref_subset)
      with G have "([], ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
       by (rule process_rule_3)
      with P and O have "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs,
        insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X) âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y)
        âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule SCF_R2)
      moreover have
       "ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs (insert None X) âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y âŠ†
        insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X) âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y"
      proof (rule subsetI, simp del: insert_iff, erule conjE)
        fix x
        have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs (insert None X) âŠ†
          insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X)"
         by (rule ipurge_ref_subset_insert)
        moreover assume "x âˆˆ ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs (insert None X)"
        ultimately show "x âˆˆ insert None (ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X)" ..
      qed
      ultimately have "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs,
        ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs (insert None X) âˆ© ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y)
        âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
       by (rule seq_comp_prop_3)
      thus ?thesis
       by (simp add: ipurge_ref_distrib_inter)
    next
      assume
        P: "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆ‰ sentences P" and
        Q: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨ (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)"
      have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs (insert None X âˆ© Y) = {}"
      proof (rule disjE [OF Q], erule_tac [2] bexE)
        assume R: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I"
        show ?thesis
        proof (rule ipurge_ref_empty [of "D y"], simp)
          fix x
          have "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I)"
           using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
          moreover have "y â‰  None"
           using N by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
          ultimately have "âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I"
           using R by simp
          thus "(D y, D x) âˆˆ I"
           by simp
        qed
      next
        fix u
        assume
          R: "u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs" and
          S: "(u, D None) âˆˆ I"
        have "âˆƒz âˆˆ set zs. u = D z"
         using R by (rule sinks_elem)
        then obtain z where T: "z âˆˆ set zs" and U: "u = D z" ..
        have V: "z â‰  None"
        proof
          assume "z = None"
          hence "None âˆˆ set zs"
           using T by simp
          moreover have "None âˆ‰ set zs"
           using L by simp
          ultimately show False
           by contradiction
        qed
        show ?thesis
        proof (rule ipurge_ref_empty [of u], simp add: R)
          fix x
          have "(D z, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ z â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D z, v) âˆˆ I)"
           using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
          moreover have "(D z, D None) âˆˆ I"
           using S and U by simp
          ultimately have "âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D z, v) âˆˆ I"
           using V by simp
          thus "(u, D x) âˆˆ I"
           using U by simp
        qed
      qed
      thus ?thesis
      proof simp
        have "{} âŠ† ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X" ..
        with O have "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, {}) âˆˆ failures P"
         by (rule process_rule_3)
        with P show "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, {})
          âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
        proof (rule SCF_R1, simp add: N)
          have "set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs) âŠ† set zs"
           by (rule ipurge_tr_set)
          moreover have "None âˆ‰ set zs"
           using L by simp
          ultimately show "None âˆ‰ set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs)"
           by (rule contra_subsetD)
        qed
      qed
    next
      assume
        P: "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆ‰ sentences P" and
        Q: "(D y, D None) âˆ‰ I âˆ§ (âˆ€u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs. (u, D None) âˆ‰ I)"
      have "xs @ zs @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
       using E by (simp add: sentences_def)
      hence "(xs @ zs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule traces_failures)
      hence "(zs @ [None], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       by (simp add: futures_def)
      moreover have "([y], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       using N by (simp add: futures_def)
      ultimately have "(y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) (zs @ [None]),
        ipurge_ref I D (D y) (zs @ [None]) {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
        (is "(_, ?Z) âˆˆ _")
       using C by (simp add: secure_def del: ipurge_tr.simps)
      hence "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) (zs @ [None]), ?Z) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (simp add: futures_def)
      hence "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) (zs @ [None]) âˆˆ traces P"
       by (rule failures_traces)
      moreover have "Â¬ ((D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
        (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) zs. (u, D None) âˆˆ I))"
       using Q by simp
      hence "D None âˆ‰ sinks I D (D y) (zs @ [None])"
       by (simp only: sinks_interference_eq, simp)
      ultimately have "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
       by simp
      hence "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs âˆˆ sentences P"
       by (simp add: sentences_def)
      thus ?thesis
       using P by contradiction
    qed
  next
    assume M: "n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}"
    have "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
      take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]), W) âˆˆ failures Q"
      (is "âˆ€n âˆˆ _. âˆ€W âˆˆ _. ?T n W")
     using I by simp
    hence "âˆ€W âˆˆ R n. ?T n W"
     using M ..
    moreover obtain W where "W âˆˆ R n"
     using K ..
    ultimately have N: "?T n W" ..
    moreover have O: "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) =
      take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)"
     using M by simp
    ultimately have P: "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) âˆˆ sentences P"
     by simp
    have Q: "drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) = []"
    proof (cases "drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)", simp)
      case (Cons v vs)
      moreover have "xs @ zs = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @
        drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)"
       by (simp only: append_take_drop_id)
      ultimately have R: "xs @ zs =
        take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ v # vs"
       by (simp del: take_append)
      hence "(take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ v # vs, X)
        âˆˆ failures P"
       using F by (simp del: take_append)
      hence "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ v # vs âˆˆ traces P"
       by (rule failures_traces)
      with B and P have "v = None"
       by (rule seq_sentences_none)
      moreover have
       "None âˆ‰ set (take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ v # vs)"
       using L by (subst (asm) R)
      hence "v â‰  None"
       by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
      ultimately show ?thesis
       by contradiction
    qed
    hence R: "zs = []"
     using M by simp
    moreover have "xs @ zs = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @
      drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)"
     by (simp only: append_take_drop_id)
    ultimately have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) = xs"
     using Q by simp
    hence "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) = xs"
     using O by simp
    moreover have "xs @ [y] = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) @
      drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y])"
     by (simp only: append_take_drop_id)
    ultimately have "drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) = [y]"
     by simp
    hence S: "([y], W) âˆˆ failures Q"
     using N by simp
    show ?thesis using E and R
    proof (rule_tac SCF_R3, simp_all)
      have "âˆ€xs y ys Y zs Z.
        (y # ys, Y) âˆˆ futures Q xs âˆ§ (zs, Z) âˆˆ futures Q xs âŸ¶
        (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y) âˆˆ futures Q xs âˆ§
        (y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Z) âˆˆ futures Q xs"
       using D by (simp add: secure_def)
      hence "([y], W) âˆˆ futures Q [] âˆ§ ([], Y) âˆˆ futures Q [] âŸ¶
        (ipurge_tr I D (D y) [], ipurge_ref I D (D y) [] W) âˆˆ futures Q [] âˆ§
        (y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) [], ipurge_ref I D (D y) [] Y) âˆˆ futures Q []"
       by blast
      moreover have "([y], W) âˆˆ futures Q []"
       using S by (simp add: futures_def)
      moreover have "([], Y) âˆˆ futures Q []"
       using G by (simp add: futures_def)
      ultimately have "([y], ipurge_ref I D (D y) [] Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
        (is "(_, ?Y') âˆˆ _")
       by (simp add: futures_def)
      moreover have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) [] (insert None X) âˆ© ?Y' âŠ† ?Y'"
       by simp
      ultimately have "([y], ipurge_ref I D (D y) [] (insert None X) âˆ© ?Y')
        âˆˆ failures Q"
       by (rule process_rule_3)
      thus "([y], ipurge_ref I D (D y) [] (insert None X âˆ© Y)) âˆˆ failures Q"
       by (simp add: ipurge_ref_distrib_inter)
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_secure_aux_2_case_3:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "ref_union_closed P" and
    C: "sequential P" and
    D: "secure P I D" and
    E: "secure Q I D" and
    F: "ws âˆˆ sentences P" and
    G: "(ys, Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
    H: "ys â‰  []" and
    I: "ws @ ys = xs @ zs" and
    J: "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  shows "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof -
  have "âˆƒR. {} = (â‹ƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. â‹ƒW âˆˆ R n. W) âˆ§
    (âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      xs @ [y] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y]) âˆ§
        (xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§ (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§
        ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§ W = insert None U âˆ© V)) âˆ§
    (âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
      take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]), W) âˆˆ failures Q) âˆ§
    (âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n)"
    (is "âˆƒR. ?T R")
   using J by (rule seq_comp_refusals_1)
  then obtain R where J: "?T R" ..
  hence "âˆƒn âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n"
   by simp
  then obtain n where K: "n âˆˆ {..length (xs @ [y])}" and L: "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R n" ..
  have M: "n = 0 âˆ¨ n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}"
   using K by auto
  show ?thesis
  proof (cases "length xs < length ws")
    case True
    have "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
      xs @ [y] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§
        None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y]) âˆ§ (xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
      xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
        (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
          W = insert None U âˆ© V)"
      (is "âˆ€W âˆˆ _. ?T W")
     using J by simp
    moreover have "n âˆ‰ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}"
    proof
      assume N: "n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}"
      hence "âˆ€W âˆˆ R n. take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P"
       using J by simp
      moreover obtain W where "W âˆˆ R n"
       using L ..
      ultimately have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P" ..
      moreover have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) =
        take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)"
       using N by simp
      ultimately have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) âˆˆ sentences P"
       by simp
      hence "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (ws @ ys) âˆˆ sentences P"
       using I by simp
      moreover have "length (xs @ [y]) - n â‰¤ length xs"
       using N by (simp, arith)
      hence O: "length (xs @ [y]) - n < length ws"
       using True by simp
      ultimately have P: "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws âˆˆ sentences P"
       by simp
      show False
      proof (cases "drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws")
        case Nil
        thus False
         using O by simp
      next
        case (Cons v vs)
        moreover have "ws = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws @
          drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws"
         by simp
        ultimately have Q: "ws = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws @ v # vs"
         by simp
        hence "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws @ v # vs âˆˆ sentences P"
         using F by simp
        hence "(take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws @ v # vs) @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (simp add: sentences_def)
        hence "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws @ v # vs âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule process_rule_2_traces)
        with C and P have "v = None"
         by (rule seq_sentences_none)
        moreover have "weakly_sequential P"
         using C by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
        hence "None âˆ‰ set ws"
         using F by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
        hence "None âˆ‰ set (take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws @ v # vs)"
         by (subst (asm) Q)
        hence "v â‰  None"
         by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
        ultimately show False
         by contradiction
      qed
    qed
    hence "n = 0"
     using M by blast
    hence "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0"
     using L by simp
    then obtain W where "W âˆˆ R 0" ..
    ultimately have "?T W" ..
    hence N: "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ None â‰  y"
    proof (cases "xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P", simp_all del: ex_simps,
     (erule_tac exE)+, (erule_tac [!] conjE)+, simp_all)
      case False
      assume "(xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P"
      moreover have "{} âŠ† W" ..
      ultimately show "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule process_rule_3)
    next
      fix U
      case True
      assume "(xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P"
      moreover have "{} âŠ† U" ..
      ultimately have "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule process_rule_3)
      moreover have "weakly_sequential P"
       using C by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
      hence "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y])"
       using True by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
      hence "None âˆ‰ set xs âˆ§ None â‰  y"
       by simp
      ultimately show ?thesis ..
    qed
    have "drop (length xs) (xs @ zs) = drop (length xs) (ws @ ys)"
     using I by simp
    hence O: "zs = drop (length xs) ws @ ys"
      (is "_ = ?ws' @ _")
     using True by simp
    let ?U = "insert (D y) (sinks I D (D y) ?ws')"
    have "ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs =
      ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys"
     using O by (simp add: ipurge_tr_append)
    moreover have "ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y = ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y"
     using O by (simp add: ipurge_ref_append)
    ultimately show ?thesis
    proof (cases "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' âˆˆ sentences P", simp_all)
      assume P: "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' âˆˆ sentences P"
      have Q: "(ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys, ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
       using E and G by (rule ipurge_tr_ref_aux_failures)
      show "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys,
        ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
      proof (cases "ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys")
        case Nil
        have "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws', {x. x â‰  None}) âˆˆ failures P"
         using B and C and P by (rule seq_sentences_ref)
        moreover have "([], ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
         using Q and Nil by simp
        ultimately have "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws',
          insert None {x. x â‰  None} âˆ© ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y)
          âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
         by (rule SCF_R2 [OF P])
        moreover have "insert None {x. x â‰  None} âˆ©
          ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y = ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y"
         by blast
        ultimately show ?thesis
         using Nil by simp
      next
        case Cons
        hence "ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys â‰  []"
         by simp
        with P and Q have
         "((xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws') @ ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys,
            ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
         by (rule SCF_R3)
        thus ?thesis
         by simp
      qed
    next
      assume P: "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' âˆ‰ sentences P"
      have "ws = take (length xs) ws @ ?ws'"
       by simp
      moreover have "take (length xs) (ws @ ys) = take (length xs) (xs @ zs)"
       using I by simp
      hence "take (length xs) ws = xs"
       using True by simp
      ultimately have "xs @ ?ws' âˆˆ sentences P"
       using F by simp
      hence "xs @ ?ws' @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
       by (simp add: sentences_def)
      hence "(xs @ ?ws' @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (rule traces_failures)
      hence "(?ws' @ [None], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       by (simp add: futures_def)
      moreover have "([y], {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       using N by (simp add: futures_def)
      ultimately have "(y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None]),
        ipurge_ref I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None]) {}) âˆˆ futures P xs"
       using D by (simp add: secure_def del: ipurge_tr.simps)
      hence Q: "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None]), {}) âˆˆ failures P"
       by (simp add: futures_def ipurge_ref_def)
      have "set ?ws' âŠ† set ws"
       by (rule set_drop_subset)
      moreover have "weakly_sequential P"
       using C by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
      hence "None âˆ‰ set ws"
       using F by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
      ultimately have R: "None âˆ‰ set ?ws'"
       by (rule contra_subsetD)
      show "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys,
        ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
      proof (cases "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
       (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)")
        assume S: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
          (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'. (u, D None) âˆˆ I)"
        have "ipurge_tr_aux I D ?U ys = []"
        proof (rule disjE [OF S], erule_tac [2] bexE)
          assume T: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I"
          show ?thesis
          proof (rule ipurge_tr_aux_nil [of "D y"], simp)
            fix x
            have "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I)"
             using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
            moreover have "y â‰  None"
             using N by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
            ultimately have "âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I"
             using T by simp
            thus "(D y, D x) âˆˆ I"
             by simp
          qed
        next
          fix u
          assume
            T: "u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'" and
            U: "(u, D None) âˆˆ I"
          have "âˆƒw âˆˆ set ?ws'. u = D w"
           using T by (rule sinks_elem)
          then obtain w where V: "w âˆˆ set ?ws'" and W: "u = D w" ..
          have X: "w â‰  None"
          proof
            assume "w = None"
            hence "None âˆˆ set ?ws'"
             using V by simp
            moreover have "None âˆ‰ set ?ws'"
             using R by simp
            ultimately show False
             by contradiction
          qed
          show ?thesis
          proof (rule ipurge_tr_aux_nil [of u], simp add: T)
            fix x
            have "(D w, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ w â‰  None âŸ¶
              (âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D w, v) âˆˆ I)"
             using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
            moreover have "(D w, D None) âˆˆ I"
             using U and W by simp
            ultimately have "âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D w, v) âˆˆ I"
             using X by simp
            thus "(u, D x) âˆˆ I"
             using W by simp
          qed
        qed
        moreover have "ipurge_ref_aux I D ?U ys Y = {}"
        proof (rule disjE [OF S], erule_tac [2] bexE)
          assume T: "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I"
          show ?thesis
          proof (rule ipurge_ref_aux_empty [of "D y"])
            have "?U âŠ† sinks_aux I D ?U ys"
             by (rule sinks_aux_subset)
            moreover have "D y âˆˆ ?U"
             by simp
            ultimately show "D y âˆˆ sinks_aux I D ?U ys" ..
          next
            fix x
            have "(D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ y â‰  None âŸ¶ (âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I)"
             using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
            moreover have "y â‰  None"
             using N by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
            ultimately have "âˆ€u âˆˆ range D. (D y, u) âˆˆ I"
             using T by simp
            thus "(D y, D x) âˆˆ I"
             by simp
          qed
        next
          fix u
          assume
            T: "u âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'" and
            U: "(u, D None) âˆˆ I"
          have "âˆƒw âˆˆ set ?ws'. u = D w"
           using T by (rule sinks_elem)
          then obtain w where V: "w âˆˆ set ?ws'" and W: "u = D w" ..
          have X: "w â‰  None"
          proof
            assume "w = None"
            hence "None âˆˆ set ?ws'"
             using V by simp
            moreover have "None âˆ‰ set ?ws'"
             using R by simp
            ultimately show False
             by contradiction
          qed
          show ?thesis
          proof (rule ipurge_ref_aux_empty [of u])
            have "?U âŠ† sinks_aux I D ?U ys"
             by (rule sinks_aux_subset)
            moreover have "u âˆˆ ?U"
             using T by simp
            ultimately show "u âˆˆ sinks_aux I D ?U ys" ..
          next
            fix x
            have "(D w, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ§ w â‰  None âŸ¶
              (âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D w, v) âˆˆ I)"
             using A by (simp add: secure_termination_def)
            moreover have "(D w, D None) âˆˆ I"
             using U and W by simp
            ultimately have "âˆ€v âˆˆ range D. (D w, v) âˆˆ I"
             using X by simp
            thus "(u, D x) âˆˆ I"
             using W by simp
          qed
        qed
        ultimately show ?thesis
        proof simp
          have "D None âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None])"
           using S by (simp only: sinks_interference_eq)
          hence "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws', {}) âˆˆ failures P"
           using Q by simp
          moreover have "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws')"
          proof (simp add: N)
            have "set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws') âŠ† set ?ws'"
             by (rule ipurge_tr_set)
            thus "None âˆ‰ set (ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws')"
             using R by (rule contra_subsetD)
          qed
          ultimately show "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws', {})
            âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
           by (rule SCF_R1 [OF P])
        qed
      next
        assume "Â¬ ((D y, D None) âˆˆ I âˆ¨
          (âˆƒu âˆˆ sinks I D (D y) ?ws'. (u, D None) âˆˆ I))"
        hence "D None âˆ‰ sinks I D (D y) (?ws' @ [None])"
         by (simp only: sinks_interference_eq, simp)
        hence "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ [None], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
         using Q by simp
        hence "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule failures_traces)
        hence "xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) ?ws' âˆˆ sentences P"
         by (simp add: sentences_def)
        thus ?thesis
         using P by contradiction
      qed
    qed
  next
    case False
    have "âˆ€n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}. âˆ€W âˆˆ R n.
      take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
      (drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]), W) âˆˆ failures Q"
      (is "âˆ€n âˆˆ _. âˆ€W âˆˆ _. ?T n W")
     using J by simp
    moreover have "n â‰  0"
    proof
      have "âˆ€W âˆˆ R 0.
        xs @ [y] âˆ‰ sentences P âˆ§
          None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y]) âˆ§ (xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P âˆ¨
        xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P âˆ§
          (âˆƒU V. (xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P âˆ§ ([], V) âˆˆ failures Q âˆ§
            W = insert None U âˆ© V)"
        (is "âˆ€W âˆˆ _. ?T' W")
       using J by blast
      moreover assume "n = 0"
      hence "âˆƒW. W âˆˆ R 0"
       using L by simp
      then obtain W where "W âˆˆ R 0" ..
      ultimately have "?T' W" ..
      hence N: "xs @ [y] âˆˆ traces P âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y])"
      proof (cases "xs @ [y] âˆˆ sentences P", simp_all del: ex_simps,
       (erule_tac exE)+, (erule_tac [!] conjE)+, simp_all)
        case False
        assume "(xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures P"
        moreover have "{} âŠ† W" ..
        ultimately have "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
         by (rule process_rule_3)
        thus "xs @ [y] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule failures_traces)
      next
        fix U
        case True
        assume "(xs @ [y], U) âˆˆ failures P"
        moreover have "{} âŠ† U" ..
        ultimately have "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures P"
         by (rule process_rule_3)
        hence "xs @ [y] âˆˆ traces P"
         by (rule failures_traces)
        moreover have "weakly_sequential P"
         using C by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
        hence "None âˆ‰ set (xs @ [y])"
         using True by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
        hence "None â‰  y âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs"
         by simp
        ultimately show "xs @ [y] âˆˆ traces P âˆ§ None â‰  y âˆ§ None âˆ‰ set xs" ..
      qed
      have "take (length xs) (xs @ zs) @ [y] = take (length xs) (ws @ ys) @ [y]"
       using I by simp
      hence "xs @ [y] = ws @ take (length xs - length ws) ys @ [y]"
       using False by simp
      moreover have "âˆƒv vs. take (length xs - length ws) ys @ [y] = v # vs"
       by (cases "take (length xs - length ws) ys @ [y]", simp_all)
      then obtain v and vs where
       "take (length xs - length ws) ys @ [y] = v # vs"
       by blast
      ultimately have O: "xs @ [y] = ws @ v # vs"
       by simp
      hence "ws @ v # vs âˆˆ traces P"
       using N by simp
      with C and F have "v = None"
       by (rule seq_sentences_none)
      moreover have "v â‰  None"
       using N and O by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
      ultimately show False
       by contradiction
    qed
    hence N: "n âˆˆ {0<..length (xs @ [y])}"
     using M by blast
    ultimately have "âˆ€W âˆˆ R n. ?T n W" ..
    moreover obtain W where "W âˆˆ R n"
     using L ..
    ultimately have O: "?T n W" ..
    have P: "length (xs @ [y]) - n â‰¤ length xs"
     using N by (simp, arith)
    have "length (xs @ [y]) - n = length ws"
    proof (rule ccontr, simp only: neq_iff, erule disjE)
      assume Q: "length (xs @ [y]) - n < length ws"
      moreover have "ws = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws @
        drop (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws"
        (is "_ = _ @ ?ws'")
       by simp
      ultimately have "ws = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (ws @ ys) @ ?ws'"
       by simp
      hence "ws = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs) @ ?ws'"
       using I by simp
      hence "ws = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) @ ?ws'"
       using P by simp
      moreover have "?ws' â‰  []"
       using Q by simp
      hence "âˆƒv vs. ?ws' = v # vs"
       by (cases ?ws', simp_all)
      then obtain v and vs where "?ws' = v # vs"
       by blast
      ultimately have S: "ws = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) @ v # vs"
       by simp
      hence "(take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) @ v # vs) @ [None]
        âˆˆ traces P"
       using F by (simp add: sentences_def)
      hence T: "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) @ v # vs âˆˆ traces P"
       by (rule process_rule_2_traces)
      have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P"
       using O ..
      with C have "v = None"
       using T by (rule seq_sentences_none)
      moreover have "weakly_sequential P"
       using C by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
      hence "None âˆ‰ set ws"
       using F by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
      hence "v â‰  None"
       using S by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
      ultimately show False
       by contradiction
    next
      assume Q: "length ws < length (xs @ [y]) - n"
      have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) =
        take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ zs)"
       using P by simp
      also have "â€¦ = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (ws @ ys)"
       using I by simp
      also have "â€¦ = take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) ws @
        take (length (xs @ [y]) - n - length ws) ys"
        (is "_ = _ @ ?ys'")
       by simp
      also have "â€¦ = ws @ ?ys'"
       using Q by simp
      finally have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) = ws @ ?ys'" .
      moreover have "?ys' â‰  []"
       using Q and H by simp
      hence "âˆƒv vs. ?ys' = v # vs"
       by (cases ?ys', simp_all)
      then obtain v and vs where "?ys' = v # vs"
       by blast
      ultimately have S: "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) = ws @ v # vs"
       by simp
      hence "(ws @ v # vs) @ [None] âˆˆ traces P"
       using O by (simp add: sentences_def)
      hence "ws @ v # vs âˆˆ traces P"
       by (rule process_rule_2_traces)
      with C and F have T: "v = None"
       by (rule seq_sentences_none)
      have "weakly_sequential P"
       using C by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
      moreover have "take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]) âˆˆ sentences P"
       using O ..
      ultimately have "None âˆ‰ set (take (length (xs @ [y]) - n) (xs @ [y]))"
       by (rule weakly_seq_sentences_none)
      hence "v â‰  None"
       using S by (rule_tac not_sym, simp)
      thus False
       using T by contradiction
    qed
    hence "(drop (length ws) (xs @ [y]), W) âˆˆ failures Q"
     using O by simp
    hence "(drop (length ws) xs @ [y], W) âˆˆ failures Q"
      (is "(?xs' @ _, _) âˆˆ _")
     using False by simp
    hence "([y], W) âˆˆ futures Q ?xs'"
     by (simp add: futures_def)
    moreover have "drop (length ws) (ws @ ys) = drop (length ws) (xs @ zs)"
     using I by simp
    hence "ys = ?xs' @ zs"
     using False by simp
    hence "(?xs' @ zs, Y) âˆˆ failures Q"
     using G by simp
    hence "(zs, Y) âˆˆ futures Q ?xs'"
     by (simp add: futures_def)
    ultimately have "(y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y)
      âˆˆ futures Q ?xs'"
     using E by (simp add: secure_def)
    hence "(?xs' @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y)
      âˆˆ failures Q"
     by (simp add: futures_def)
    moreover have "?xs' @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs â‰  []"
     by simp
    ultimately have "(ws @ ?xs' @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs,
      ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by (rule SCF_R3 [OF F])
    hence "((ws @ ?xs') @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs,
      ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     by simp
    moreover have "xs = take (length ws) xs @ ?xs'"
     by simp
    hence "xs = take (length ws) (xs @ zs) @ ?xs'"
     using False by simp
    hence "xs = take (length ws) (ws @ ys) @ ?xs'"
     using I by simp
    hence "xs = ws @ ?xs'"
     by simp
    ultimately show ?thesis
     by simp
  qed
qed

lemma seq_comp_secure_aux_2 [rule_format]:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "ref_union_closed P" and
    C: "sequential P" and
    D: "secure P I D" and
    E: "secure Q I D"
  shows "(ws, Z) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹
    ws = xs @ zs âŸ¶
    (xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¶
    (xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Z)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
proof (erule seq_comp_failures.induct, (rule_tac [!] impI)+, simp_all, (erule conjE)+)
  fix X
  assume
   "xs @ zs âˆ‰ sentences P" and
   "(xs @ zs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
   "None âˆ‰ set xs" and
   "None âˆ‰ set zs" and
   "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  thus "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_secure_aux_2_case_1 [OF A C D])
next
  fix X Y
  assume
   "xs @ zs âˆˆ sentences P" and
   "(xs @ zs, X) âˆˆ failures P" and
   "([], Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
   "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  thus "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs,
    ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs (insert None X âˆ© Y)) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_secure_aux_2_case_2 [OF A C D E])
next
  fix ws ys Y
  assume
   "ws âˆˆ sentences P" and
   "(ys, Y) âˆˆ failures Q" and
   "ys â‰  []" and
   "ws @ ys = xs @ zs" and
   "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  thus "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule seq_comp_secure_aux_2_case_3 [OF A B C D E])
next
  fix X Y
  assume
   "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
   "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  hence "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs,
    ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs X âˆª ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Y)
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (rule SCF_R4)
  thus "(xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs (X âˆª Y))
    âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
   by (simp add: ipurge_ref_distrib_union)
qed

lemma seq_comp_secure_2:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "ref_union_closed P" and
    C: "sequential P" and
    D: "secure P I D" and
    E: "secure Q I D"
  shows "(xs @ zs, Z) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹
    (xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âŸ¹
    (xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Z)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
by (rule seq_comp_secure_aux_2 [OF A B C D E, where ws = "xs @ zs"], simp_all)

text â€¹
\null

Finally, the target security conservation theorem can be enunciated and proven, which is done here
below. The theorem states that for any two processes @{term P}, @{term Q} defined over the same
alphabet containing successful termination, to which the noninterference policy @{term I} and the
event-domain map @{term D} apply, if:

\begin{itemize}

\item
@{term I} and @{term D} enforce termination security,

\item
@{term P} is refusals union closed and sequential, and

\item
both @{term P} and @{term Q} are secure with respect to @{term I} and @{term D},

\end{itemize}

then @{term "P ; Q"} is secure as well.

\null
â€º

theorem seq_comp_secure:
  assumes
    A: "secure_termination I D" and
    B: "ref_union_closed P" and
    C: "sequential P" and
    D: "secure P I D" and
    E: "secure Q I D"
  shows "secure (P ; Q) I D"
proof (simp add: secure_def seq_comp_futures seq_implies_weakly_seq [OF C],
 (rule allI)+, rule impI, erule conjE)
  fix xs y ys Y zs Z
  assume
    F: "(xs @ y # ys, Y) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q" and
    G: "(xs @ zs, Z) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
  show
   "(xs @ ipurge_tr I D (D y) ys, ipurge_ref I D (D y) ys Y)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q âˆ§
    (xs @ y # ipurge_tr I D (D y) zs, ipurge_ref I D (D y) zs Z)
      âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
    (is "?A âˆ§ ?B")
  proof
    show ?A
     by (rule seq_comp_secure_1 [OF A B C D E F])
  next
    have H: "weakly_sequential P"
     using C by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
    hence "((xs @ [y]) @ ys, Y) âˆˆ failures (P ; Q)"
     using F by (simp add: seq_comp_failures)
    hence "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ failures (P ; Q)"
     by (rule process_rule_2_failures)
    hence "(xs @ [y], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures P Q"
     using H by (simp add: seq_comp_failures)
    thus ?B
     by (rule seq_comp_secure_2 [OF A B C D E G])
  qed
qed


subsection "Generalization of the security conservation theorem to lists of processes"

text â€¹
The target security conservation theorem, in the basic version just proven, applies to the
sequential composition of a pair of processes. However, given an arbitrary list of processes where
each process satisfies its assumptions, the theorem could be orderly applied to the composition of
the first two processes in the list, then to the composition of the resulting process with the third
process in the list, and so on, until the last process is reached. The final outcome would be that
the sequential composition of all the processes in the list is secure.

Of course, this argument works provided that the assumptions of the theorem keep being satisfied by
the composed processes produced in each step of the recursion. But this is what indeed happens, by
virtue of the conservation of refusals union closure and sequentiality under sequential composition,
proven previously, and of the conservation of security under sequential composition, ensured by the
target theorem itself.

Therefore, the target security conservation theorem can be generalized to an arbitrary list of
processes, which is done here below. The resulting theorem states that for any nonempty list of
processes defined over the same alphabet containing successful termination, to which the
noninterference policy @{term I} and the event-domain map @{term D} apply, if:

\begin{itemize}

\item
@{term I} and @{term D} enforce termination security,

\item
each process in the list, with the possible exception of the last one, is refusals union closed and
sequential, and

\item
each process in the list is secure with respect to @{term I} and @{term D},

\end{itemize}

then the sequential composition of all the processes in the list is secure as well.

As a precondition, the above conservation lemmas for weak sequentiality, refusals union closure, and
sequentiality are generalized, too.

\null
â€º

lemma seq_comp_list_weakly_sequential [rule_format]:
 "(âˆ€X âˆˆ set (P # PS). weakly_sequential X) âŸ¶
    weakly_sequential (foldl (;) P PS)"
proof (induction PS rule: rev_induct, simp, rule impI, simp, (erule conjE)+)
qed (rule seq_comp_weakly_sequential)

lemma seq_comp_list_ref_union_closed [rule_format]:
 "(âˆ€X âˆˆ set (butlast (P # PS)). weakly_sequential X) âŸ¶
  (âˆ€X âˆˆ set (P # PS). ref_union_closed X) âŸ¶
    ref_union_closed (foldl (;) P PS)"
proof (induction PS rule: rev_induct, simp, (rule impI)+, simp, split if_split_asm,
 simp, rule seq_comp_ref_union_closed, assumption+)
  fix PS and Q :: "'a option process"
  assume
    A: "weakly_sequential P" and
    B: "âˆ€X âˆˆ set PS. weakly_sequential X" and
    C: "ref_union_closed Q" and
    D: "(âˆ€X âˆˆ set (P # butlast PS). weakly_sequential X) âŸ¶
      ref_union_closed (foldl (;) P PS)"
  have "weakly_sequential (foldl (;) P PS)"
  proof (rule seq_comp_list_weakly_sequential, simp, erule disjE, simp add: A)
    fix X
    assume "X âˆˆ set PS"
    with B show "weakly_sequential X" ..
  qed
  moreover have "âˆ€X âˆˆ set (P # butlast PS). weakly_sequential X"
  proof (rule ballI, simp, erule disjE, simp add: A)
    fix X
    assume "X âˆˆ set (butlast PS)"
    hence "X âˆˆ set PS"
     by (rule in_set_butlastD)
    with B show "weakly_sequential X" ..
  qed
  with D have "ref_union_closed (foldl (;) P PS)" ..
  ultimately show "ref_union_closed (foldl (;) P PS ; Q)"
   using C by (rule seq_comp_ref_union_closed)
qed

lemma seq_comp_list_sequential [rule_format]:
 "(âˆ€X âˆˆ set (P # PS). sequential X) âŸ¶
    sequential (foldl (;) P PS)"
proof (induction PS rule: rev_induct, simp, rule impI, simp, (erule conjE)+)
qed (rule seq_comp_sequential)

theorem seq_comp_list_secure [rule_format]:
  assumes A: "secure_termination I D"
  shows
   "(âˆ€X âˆˆ set (butlast (P # PS)). ref_union_closed X âˆ§ sequential X) âŸ¶
    (âˆ€X âˆˆ set (P # PS). secure X I D) âŸ¶
      secure (foldl (;) P PS) I D"
proof (induction PS rule: rev_induct, simp, (rule impI)+, simp, split if_split_asm,
 simp, rule seq_comp_secure [OF A], assumption+)
  fix PS Q
  assume
    B: "PS â‰  []" and
    C: "ref_union_closed P" and
    D: "sequential P" and
    E: "âˆ€X âˆˆ set PS. ref_union_closed X âˆ§ sequential X" and
    F: "secure Q I D" and
    G: "(âˆ€X âˆˆ set (P # butlast PS). ref_union_closed X âˆ§ sequential X) âŸ¶
      secure (foldl (;) P PS) I D"
  have "ref_union_closed (foldl (;) P PS)"
  proof (rule seq_comp_list_ref_union_closed, simp_all add: B, erule_tac [!] disjE,
   simp_all add: C)
    show "weakly_sequential P"
     using D by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
  next
    fix X
    assume "X âˆˆ set (butlast PS)"
    hence "X âˆˆ set PS"
     by (rule in_set_butlastD)
    with E have "ref_union_closed X âˆ§ sequential X" ..
    hence "sequential X" ..
    thus "weakly_sequential X"
     by (rule seq_implies_weakly_seq)
  next
    fix X
    assume "X âˆˆ set PS"
    with E have "ref_union_closed X âˆ§ sequential X" ..
    thus "ref_union_closed X" ..
  qed
  moreover have "sequential (foldl (;) P PS)"
  proof (rule seq_comp_list_sequential, simp, erule disjE, simp add: D)
    fix X
    assume "X âˆˆ set PS"
    with E have "ref_union_closed X âˆ§ sequential X" ..
    thus "sequential X" ..
  qed
  moreover have "âˆ€X âˆˆ set (P # butlast PS). ref_union_closed X âˆ§ sequential X"
  proof (rule ballI, simp, erule disjE, simp add: C D)
    fix X
    assume "X âˆˆ set (butlast PS)"
    hence "X âˆˆ set PS"
     by (rule in_set_butlastD)
    with E show "ref_union_closed X âˆ§ sequential X" ..
  qed
  with G have "secure (foldl (;) P PS) I D" ..
  ultimately show "secure (foldl (;) P PS ; Q) I D"
   using F by (rule seq_comp_secure [OF A])
qed

end

Theory Counterexamples

(*  Title:       Conservation of CSP Noninterference Security under Sequential Composition
    Author:      Pasquale Noce
                 Security Certification Specialist at Arjo Systems, Italy
                 pasquale dot noce dot lavoro at gmail dot com
                 pasquale dot noce at arjosystems dot com
*)

section "Necessity of nontrivial assumptions"

theory Counterexamples
imports SequentialComposition
begin

text â€¹
\null

The security conservation theorem proven in this paper contains two nontrivial assumptions; namely,
the security policy must satisfy predicate @{term secure_termination}, and the first input process
must satisfy predicate @{term sequential} instead of @{term weakly_sequential} alone. This section
shows, by means of counterexamples, that both of these assumptions are necessary for the theorem to
hold.

In more detail, two counterexamples will be constructed: the former drops the termination security
assumption, whereas the latter drops the process sequentiality assumption, replacing it with weak
sequentiality alone. In both cases, all the other assumptions of the theorem keep being satisfied.

Both counterexamples make use of reflexive security policies, which is the case for any policy of
practical significance, and are based on trace set processes as defined in \cite{R3}. The security
of the processes input to sequential composition, as well as the insecurity of the resulting
process, are demonstrated by means of the Ipurge Unwinding Theorem proven in \cite{R3}.
â€º


subsection "Preliminary definitions and lemmas"

text â€¹
Both counterexamples will use the same type @{term event} as native type of ordinary events, as well
as the same process @{term Q} as second input to sequential composition. Here below are the
definitions of these constants, followed by few useful lemmas on process @{term Q}.

\null
â€º

datatype event = a | b

definition Q :: "event option process" where
"Q â‰¡ ts_process {[], [Some b]}"

lemma trace_set_snd:
 "trace_set {[], [Some b]}"
by (simp add: trace_set_def)

lemmas failures_snd = ts_process_failures [OF trace_set_snd]

lemmas traces_snd = ts_process_traces [OF trace_set_snd]

lemmas next_events_snd = ts_process_next_events [OF trace_set_snd]

lemmas unwinding_snd = ts_ipurge_unwinding [OF trace_set_snd]


subsection "Necessity of termination security"

text â€¹
The reason why the conservation of noninterference security under sequential composition requires
the security policy to satisfy predicate @{term secure_termination} is that the second input process
cannot engage in its events unless the first process has terminated successfully. Thus, the ordinary
events of the first process can indirectly affect the events of the second process by affecting the
successful termination of the first process. Therefore, if an ordinary event is allowed to affect
successful termination, then the policy must allow it to affect any other event as well, which is
exactly what predicate @{term secure_termination} states.

A counterexample showing the necessity of this assumption can then be constructed by defining a
reflexive policy @{term Iâ‡©1} that allows event @{term "Some a"} to affect @{term None}, but not
@{term "Some b"}, and a deterministic process @{term Pâ‡©1} that can engage in @{term None} only after
engaging in @{term "Some a"}. The resulting process @{term "Pâ‡©1 ; Q"} will number
@{term "[Some a, Some b]"}, but not @{term "[Some b]"}, among its traces, so that event
@{term "Some a"} affects the occurrence of event @{term "Some b"} in contrast with policy
@{term Iâ‡©1}, viz. @{term "Pâ‡©1 ; Q"} is not secure with respect to @{term Iâ‡©1}.

Here below are the definitions of constants @{term Iâ‡©1} and @{term Pâ‡©1}, followed by few useful lemmas
on process @{term Pâ‡©1}.

\null
â€º

definition Iâ‡©1 :: "(event option Ã— event option) set" where
"Iâ‡©1 â‰¡ {(Some a, None)}â‡§="

definition Pâ‡©1 :: "event option process" where
"Pâ‡©1 â‰¡ ts_process {[], [Some a], [Some a, None]}"

lemma trace_set_fst_1:
 "trace_set {[], [Some a], [Some a, None]}"
by (simp add: trace_set_def)

lemmas failures_fst_1 = ts_process_failures [OF trace_set_fst_1]

lemmas traces_fst_1 = ts_process_traces [OF trace_set_fst_1]

lemmas next_events_fst_1 = ts_process_next_events [OF trace_set_fst_1]

lemmas unwinding_fst_1 = ts_ipurge_unwinding [OF trace_set_fst_1]

text â€¹
\null

Here below is the proof that policy @{term Iâ‡©1} does not satisfy predicate
@{term secure_termination}, whereas the remaining assumptions of the security conservation theorem
keep being satisfied. For the sake of simplicity, the identity function is used as event-domain map.

\null
â€º

lemma not_secure_termination_1:
 "Â¬ secure_termination Iâ‡©1 id"
proof (simp add: secure_termination_def Iâ‡©1_def, rule exI [where x = "Some a"],
 simp)
qed (rule exI [where x = "Some b"], simp)

lemma ref_union_closed_fst_1:
 "ref_union_closed Pâ‡©1"
by (rule d_implies_ruc, subst Pâ‡©1_def, rule ts_process_d, rule trace_set_fst_1)

lemma sequential_fst_1:
 "sequential Pâ‡©1"
proof (simp add: sequential_def sentences_def Pâ‡©1_def traces_fst_1)
qed (simp add: set_eq_iff next_events_fst_1)

lemma secure_fst_1:
 "secure Pâ‡©1 Iâ‡©1 id"
proof (simp add: Pâ‡©1_def unwinding_fst_1 dfc_equals_dwfc_rel_ipurge [symmetric]
 d_future_consistent_def rel_ipurge_def traces_fst_1, (rule allI)+)
  fix u xs ys
  show
   "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
    (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
    ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u ys âŸ¶
      next_dom_events (ts_process {[], [Some a], [Some a, None]}) id u xs =
      next_dom_events (ts_process {[], [Some a], [Some a, None]}) id u ys"
  proof (simp add: next_dom_events_def next_events_fst_1, cases u)
    case None
    show
     "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
      (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
      ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u ys âŸ¶
        {x. u = x âˆ§ (xs = [] âˆ§ x = Some a âˆ¨ xs = [Some a] âˆ§ x = None)} =
        {x. u = x âˆ§ (ys = [] âˆ§ x = Some a âˆ¨ ys = [Some a] âˆ§ x = None)}"
     by (simp add: Iâ‡©1_def None, rule impI, (erule conjE)+,
      (((erule disjE)+)?, simp)+)
  next
    case (Some v)
    show
     "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
      (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
      ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u ys âŸ¶
        {x. u = x âˆ§ (xs = [] âˆ§ x = Some a âˆ¨ xs = [Some a] âˆ§ x = None)} =
        {x. u = x âˆ§ (ys = [] âˆ§ x = Some a âˆ¨ ys = [Some a] âˆ§ x = None)}"
     by (simp add: Iâ‡©1_def Some, rule impI, (erule conjE)+, cases v,
      (((erule disjE)+)?, simp, blast?)+)
  qed
qed

lemma secure_snd_1:
 "secure Q Iâ‡©1 id"
proof (simp add: Q_def unwinding_snd dfc_equals_dwfc_rel_ipurge [symmetric]
 d_future_consistent_def rel_ipurge_def traces_snd, (rule allI)+)
  fix u xs ys
  show
   "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some b]) âˆ§
    (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some b]) âˆ§
    ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u ys âŸ¶
      next_dom_events (ts_process {[], [Some b]}) id u xs =
      next_dom_events (ts_process {[], [Some b]}) id u ys"
  proof (simp add: next_dom_events_def next_events_snd, cases u)
    case None
    show
     "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some b]) âˆ§
      (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some b]) âˆ§
      ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u ys âŸ¶
        {x. u = x âˆ§ xs = [] âˆ§ x = Some b} = {x. u = x âˆ§ ys = [] âˆ§ x = Some b}"
     by (simp add: None, rule impI, (erule conjE)+,
      (((erule disjE)+)?, simp)+)
  next
    case (Some v)
    show
     "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some b]) âˆ§
      (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some b]) âˆ§
      ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id u ys âŸ¶
        {x. u = x âˆ§ xs = [] âˆ§ x = Some b} = {x. u = x âˆ§ ys = [] âˆ§ x = Some b}"
     by (simp add: Iâ‡©1_def Some, rule impI, (erule conjE)+, cases v,
      (((erule disjE)+)?, simp)+)
  qed
qed

text â€¹
\null

In what follows, the insecurity of process @{term "Pâ‡©1 ; Q"} is demonstrated by proving that event
list @{term "[Some a, Some b]"} is a trace of the process, whereas @{term "[Some b]"} is not.

\null
â€º

lemma traces_comp_1:
 "traces (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) = Domain (seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©1 Q)"
by (subst seq_comp_traces, rule seq_implies_weakly_seq, rule sequential_fst_1, simp)

lemma ref_union_closed_comp_1:
 "ref_union_closed (Pâ‡©1 ; Q)"
proof (rule seq_comp_ref_union_closed, rule seq_implies_weakly_seq,
 rule sequential_fst_1, rule ref_union_closed_fst_1)
qed (rule d_implies_ruc, subst Q_def, rule ts_process_d, rule trace_set_snd)

lemma not_secure_comp_1_aux_aux_1:
 "(xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©1 Q âŸ¹ xs â‰  [Some b]"
proof (rule notI, erule rev_mp, erule seq_comp_failures.induct, (rule_tac [!] impI)+,
 simp_all add: Pâ‡©1_def Q_def sentences_def)
qed (simp_all add: failures_fst_1 traces_fst_1)

lemma not_secure_comp_1_aux_1:
 "[Some b] âˆ‰ traces (Pâ‡©1 ; Q)"
proof (simp add: traces_comp_1 Domain_iff, rule allI, rule notI)
qed (drule not_secure_comp_1_aux_aux_1, simp)

lemma not_secure_comp_1_aux_2:
 "[Some a, Some b] âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©1 ; Q)"
proof (simp add: traces_comp_1 Domain_iff, rule exI [where x = "{}"])
  have "[Some a] âˆˆ sentences Pâ‡©1"
   by (simp add: Pâ‡©1_def sentences_def traces_fst_1)
  moreover have "([Some b], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
   by (simp add: Q_def failures_snd)
  moreover have "[Some b] â‰  []"
   by simp
  ultimately have "([Some a] @ [Some b], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©1 Q"
   by (rule SCF_R3)
  thus "([Some a, Some b], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©1 Q"
   by simp
qed

lemma not_secure_comp_1:
 "Â¬ secure (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) Iâ‡©1 id"
proof (subst ipurge_unwinding, rule ref_union_closed_comp_1, simp
 add: fc_equals_wfc_rel_ipurge [symmetric] future_consistent_def rel_ipurge_def
 del: disj_not1, rule exI [where x = "Some b"], rule exI [where x = "[]"], rule conjI)
  show "[] âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©1 ; Q)"
   by (rule failures_traces [where X = "{}"], rule process_rule_1)
next
  show "âˆƒys. ys âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) âˆ§
    ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id (Some b) [] = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id (Some b) ys âˆ§
    (next_dom_events (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) id (Some b) [] â‰ 
       next_dom_events (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) id (Some b) ys âˆ¨
     ref_dom_events (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) id (Some b) [] â‰ 
       ref_dom_events (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) id (Some b) ys)"
  proof (rule exI [where x = "[Some a]"], rule conjI, rule_tac [2] conjI,
   rule_tac [3] disjI1)
    have "[Some a] @ [Some b] âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©1 ; Q)"
     by (simp add: not_secure_comp_1_aux_2)
    thus "[Some a] âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©1 ; Q)"
     by (rule process_rule_2_traces)
  next
    show "ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id (Some b) [] = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©1 id (Some b) [Some a]"
     by (simp add: Iâ‡©1_def)
  next
    show
     "next_dom_events (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) id (Some b) [] â‰ 
      next_dom_events (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) id (Some b) [Some a]"
    proof (simp add: next_dom_events_def next_events_def set_eq_iff,
     rule exI [where x = "Some b"], simp)
    qed (simp add: not_secure_comp_1_aux_1 not_secure_comp_1_aux_2)
  qed
qed

text â€¹
\null

Here below, the previous results are used to show that constants @{term Iâ‡©1}, @{term Pâ‡©1}, @{term Q},
and @{term id} indeed constitute a counterexample to the statement obtained by removing termination
security from the assumptions of the security conservation theorem.

\null
â€º

lemma counterexample_1:
 "Â¬ (ref_union_closed Pâ‡©1 âˆ§
     sequential Pâ‡©1 âˆ§
     secure Pâ‡©1 Iâ‡©1 id âˆ§
     secure Q Iâ‡©1 id âŸ¶
   secure (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) Iâ‡©1 id)"
proof (simp, simp only: conj_assoc [symmetric], (rule conjI)+)
  show "ref_union_closed Pâ‡©1"
   by (rule ref_union_closed_fst_1)
next
  show "sequential Pâ‡©1"
   by (rule sequential_fst_1)
next
  show "secure Pâ‡©1 Iâ‡©1 id"
   by (rule secure_fst_1)
next
  show "secure Q Iâ‡©1 id"
   by (rule secure_snd_1)
next
  show "Â¬ secure (Pâ‡©1 ; Q) Iâ‡©1 id"
   by (rule not_secure_comp_1)
qed


subsection "Necessity of process sequentiality"

text â€¹
The reason why the conservation of noninterference security under sequential composition requires
the first input process to satisfy predicate @{term sequential}, instead of the more permissive
predicate @{term weakly_sequential}, is that the possibility for the first process to engage in
events alternative to successful termination entails the possibility for the resulting process to
engage in events alternative to the initial ones of the second process. Namely, the resulting
process would admit some state in which events of the first process can occur in alternative to
events of the second process. But neither process, though being secure on its own, will in general
be prepared to handle securely the alternative events added by the other process. Therefore, the
first process must not admit alternatives to successful termination, which is exactly what predicate
@{term sequential} states in addition to @{term weakly_sequential}.

A counterexample showing the necessity of this assumption can then be constructed by defining a
reflexive policy @{term Iâ‡©2} that does not allow event @{term "Some b"} to affect @{term "Some a"},
and a deterministic process @{term Pâ‡©2} that can engage in @{term "Some a"} in alternative to
@{term None}. The resulting process @{term "Pâ‡©2 ; Q"} will number both @{term "[Some b]"} and
@{term "[Some a]"}, but not @{term "[Some b, Some a]"}, among its traces, so that event
@{term "Some b"} affects the occurrence of event @{term "Some a"} in contrast with policy
@{term Iâ‡©2}, viz. @{term "Pâ‡©2 ; Q"} is not secure with respect to @{term Iâ‡©2}.

Here below are the definitions of constants @{term Iâ‡©2} and @{term Pâ‡©2}, followed by few useful lemmas
on process @{term Pâ‡©2}.

\null
â€º

definition Iâ‡©2 :: "(event option Ã— event option) set" where
"Iâ‡©2 â‰¡ {(None, Some a)}â‡§="

definition Pâ‡©2 :: "event option process" where
"Pâ‡©2 â‰¡ ts_process {[], [None], [Some a], [Some a, None]}"

lemma trace_set_fst_2:
 "trace_set {[], [None], [Some a], [Some a, None]}"
by (simp add: trace_set_def)

lemmas failures_fst_2 = ts_process_failures [OF trace_set_fst_2]

lemmas traces_fst_2 = ts_process_traces [OF trace_set_fst_2]

lemmas next_events_fst_2 = ts_process_next_events [OF trace_set_fst_2]

lemmas unwinding_fst_2 = ts_ipurge_unwinding [OF trace_set_fst_2]

text â€¹
\null

Here below is the proof that process @{term Pâ‡©2} does not satisfy predicate @{term sequential}, but
rather predicate @{term weakly_sequential} only, whereas the remaining assumptions of the security
conservation theorem keep being satisfied. For the sake of simplicity, the identity function is used
as event-domain map.

\null
â€º

lemma secure_termination_2:
 "secure_termination Iâ‡©2 id"
by (simp add: secure_termination_def Iâ‡©2_def)

lemma ref_union_closed_fst_2:
 "ref_union_closed Pâ‡©2"
by (rule d_implies_ruc, subst Pâ‡©2_def, rule ts_process_d, rule trace_set_fst_2)

lemma weakly_sequential_fst_2:
 "weakly_sequential Pâ‡©2"
by (simp add: weakly_sequential_def Pâ‡©2_def traces_fst_2)

lemma not_sequential_fst_2:
 "Â¬ sequential Pâ‡©2"
proof (simp add: sequential_def, rule disjI2, rule bexI [where x = "[]"])
  show "next_events Pâ‡©2 [] â‰  {None}"
  proof (rule notI, drule eqset_imp_iff [where x = "Some a"], simp)
  qed (simp add: Pâ‡©2_def next_events_fst_2)
next
  show "[] âˆˆ sentences Pâ‡©2"
   by (simp add: sentences_def Pâ‡©2_def traces_fst_2)
qed

lemma secure_fst_2:
 "secure Pâ‡©2 Iâ‡©2 id"
proof (simp add: Pâ‡©2_def unwinding_fst_2 dfc_equals_dwfc_rel_ipurge [symmetric]
 d_future_consistent_def rel_ipurge_def traces_fst_2, (rule allI)+)
  fix u xs ys
  show
   "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [None] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
    (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [None] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
    ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u ys âŸ¶
      next_dom_events (ts_process {[], [None], [Some a], [Some a, None]}) id u xs =
      next_dom_events (ts_process {[], [None], [Some a], [Some a, None]}) id u ys"
  proof (simp add: next_dom_events_def next_events_fst_2, cases u)
    case None
    show
     "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [None] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
      (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [None] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
      ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u ys âŸ¶
        {x. u = x âˆ§ (xs = [] âˆ§ x = None âˆ¨ xs = [] âˆ§ x = Some a âˆ¨
          xs = [Some a] âˆ§ x = None)} =
        {x. u = x âˆ§ (ys = [] âˆ§ x = None âˆ¨ ys = [] âˆ§ x = Some a âˆ¨
          ys = [Some a] âˆ§ x = None)}"
     by (simp add: Iâ‡©2_def None, rule impI, (erule conjE)+,
      (((erule disjE)+)?, simp, blast?)+)
  next
    case (Some v)
    show
     "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [None] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a] âˆ¨ xs = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
      (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [None] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a] âˆ¨ ys = [Some a, None]) âˆ§
      ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u ys âŸ¶
        {x. u = x âˆ§ (xs = [] âˆ§ x = None âˆ¨ xs = [] âˆ§ x = Some a âˆ¨
          xs = [Some a] âˆ§ x = None)} =
        {x. u = x âˆ§ (ys = [] âˆ§ x = None âˆ¨ ys = [] âˆ§ x = Some a âˆ¨
          ys = [Some a] âˆ§ x = None)}"
     by (simp add: Iâ‡©2_def Some, rule impI, (erule conjE)+, cases v,
      (((erule disjE)+)?, simp, blast?)+)
  qed
qed

lemma secure_snd_2:
 "secure Q Iâ‡©2 id"
proof (simp add: Q_def unwinding_snd dfc_equals_dwfc_rel_ipurge [symmetric]
 d_future_consistent_def rel_ipurge_def traces_snd, (rule allI)+)
  fix u xs ys
  show
   "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some b]) âˆ§
    (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some b]) âˆ§
    ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u ys âŸ¶
      next_dom_events (ts_process {[], [Some b]}) id u xs =
      next_dom_events (ts_process {[], [Some b]}) id u ys"
  proof (simp add: next_dom_events_def next_events_snd, cases u)
    case None
    show
     "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some b]) âˆ§
      (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some b]) âˆ§
      ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u ys âŸ¶
        {x. u = x âˆ§ xs = [] âˆ§ x = Some b} = {x. u = x âˆ§ ys = [] âˆ§ x = Some b}"
     by (simp add: None, rule impI, (erule conjE)+,
      (((erule disjE)+)?, simp)+)
  next
    case (Some v)
    show
     "(xs = [] âˆ¨ xs = [Some b]) âˆ§
      (ys = [] âˆ¨ ys = [Some b]) âˆ§
      ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u xs = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id u ys âŸ¶
        {x. u = x âˆ§ xs = [] âˆ§ x = Some b} = {x. u = x âˆ§ ys = [] âˆ§ x = Some b}"
     by (simp add: Iâ‡©2_def Some, rule impI, (erule conjE)+, cases v,
      (((erule disjE)+)?, simp)+)
  qed
qed

text â€¹
\null

In what follows, the insecurity of process @{term "Pâ‡©2 ; Q"} is demonstrated by proving that event
lists @{term "[Some b]"} and @{term "[Some a]"} are traces of the process, whereas
@{term "[Some b, Some a]"} is not.

\null
â€º

lemma traces_comp_2:
 "traces (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) = Domain (seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©2 Q)"
by (subst seq_comp_traces, rule weakly_sequential_fst_2, simp)

lemma ref_union_closed_comp_2:
 "ref_union_closed (Pâ‡©2 ; Q)"
proof (rule seq_comp_ref_union_closed, rule weakly_sequential_fst_2,
 rule ref_union_closed_fst_2)
qed (rule d_implies_ruc, subst Q_def, rule ts_process_d, rule trace_set_snd)

lemma not_secure_comp_2_aux_aux_1:
 "(xs, X) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©2 Q âŸ¹ xs â‰  [Some b, Some a]"
proof (rule notI, erule rev_mp, erule seq_comp_failures.induct, (rule_tac [!] impI)+,
 simp_all add: Pâ‡©2_def Q_def sentences_def)
qed (simp_all add: failures_fst_2 traces_fst_2 failures_snd)

lemma not_secure_comp_2_aux_1:
 "[Some b, Some a] âˆ‰ traces (Pâ‡©2 ; Q)"
proof (simp add: traces_comp_2 Domain_iff, rule allI, rule notI)
qed (drule not_secure_comp_2_aux_aux_1, simp)

lemma not_secure_comp_2_aux_2:
 "[Some a] âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©2 ; Q)"
proof (simp add: traces_comp_2 Domain_iff, rule exI [where x = "{}"])
  have "[Some a] âˆˆ sentences Pâ‡©2"
   by (simp add: Pâ‡©2_def sentences_def traces_fst_2)
  moreover have "([Some a], {}) âˆˆ failures Pâ‡©2"
   by (simp add: Pâ‡©2_def failures_fst_2)
  moreover have "([], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
   by (simp add: Q_def failures_snd)
  ultimately have "([Some a], insert None {} âˆ© {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©2 Q"
   by (rule SCF_R2)
  thus "([Some a], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©2 Q"
   by simp
qed

lemma not_secure_comp_2_aux_3:
 "[Some b] âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©2 ; Q)"
proof (simp add: traces_comp_2 Domain_iff, rule exI [where x = "{}"])
  have "[] âˆˆ sentences Pâ‡©2"
   by (simp add: Pâ‡©2_def sentences_def traces_fst_2)
  moreover have "([Some b], {}) âˆˆ failures Q"
   by (simp add: Q_def failures_snd)
  moreover have "[Some b] â‰  []"
   by simp
  ultimately have "([] @ [Some b], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©2 Q"
   by (rule SCF_R3)
  thus "([Some b], {}) âˆˆ seq_comp_failures Pâ‡©2 Q"
   by simp
qed

lemma not_secure_comp_2:
 "Â¬ secure (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) Iâ‡©2 id"
proof (subst ipurge_unwinding, rule ref_union_closed_comp_2, simp
 add: fc_equals_wfc_rel_ipurge [symmetric] future_consistent_def rel_ipurge_def
 del: disj_not1, rule exI [where x = "Some a"], rule exI [where x = "[]"], rule conjI)
  show "[] âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©2 ; Q)"
   by (rule failures_traces [where X = "{}"], rule process_rule_1)
next
  show "âˆƒys. ys âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) âˆ§
    ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id (Some a) [] = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id (Some a) ys âˆ§
    (next_dom_events (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) id (Some a) [] â‰ 
       next_dom_events (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) id (Some a) ys âˆ¨
     ref_dom_events (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) id (Some a) [] â‰ 
       ref_dom_events (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) id (Some a) ys)"
  proof (rule exI [where x = "[Some b]"], rule conjI, rule_tac [2] conjI,
   rule_tac [3] disjI1)
    show "[Some b] âˆˆ traces (Pâ‡©2 ; Q)"
     by (rule not_secure_comp_2_aux_3)
  next
    show "ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id (Some a) [] = ipurge_tr_rev Iâ‡©2 id (Some a) [Some b]"
     by (simp add: Iâ‡©2_def)
  next
    show
     "next_dom_events (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) id (Some a) [] â‰ 
      next_dom_events (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) id (Some a) [Some b]"
    proof (simp add: next_dom_events_def next_events_def set_eq_iff,
     rule exI [where x = "Some a"], simp)
    qed (simp add: not_secure_comp_2_aux_1 not_secure_comp_2_aux_2)
  qed
qed

text â€¹
\null

Here below, the previous results are used to show that constants @{term Iâ‡©2}, @{term Pâ‡©2}, @{term Q},
and @{term id} indeed constitute a counterexample to the statement obtained by replacing process
sequentiality with weak sequentiality in the assumptions of the security conservation theorem.

\null
â€º

lemma counterexample_2:
 "Â¬ (secure_termination Iâ‡©2 id âˆ§
     ref_union_closed Pâ‡©2 âˆ§
     weakly_sequential Pâ‡©2 âˆ§
     secure Pâ‡©2 Iâ‡©2 id âˆ§
     secure Q Iâ‡©2 id âŸ¶
   secure (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) Iâ‡©2 id)"
proof (simp, simp only: conj_assoc [symmetric], (rule conjI)+)
  show "secure_termination Iâ‡©2 id"
   by (rule secure_termination_2)
next
  show "ref_union_closed Pâ‡©2"
   by (rule ref_union_closed_fst_2)
next
  show "weakly_sequential Pâ‡©2"
   by (rule weakly_sequential_fst_2)
next
  show "secure Pâ‡©2 Iâ‡©2 id"
   by (rule secure_fst_2)
next
  show "secure Q Iâ‡©2 id"
   by (rule secure_snd_2)
next
  show "Â¬ secure (Pâ‡©2 ; Q) Iâ‡©2 id"
   by (rule not_secure_comp_2)
qed

end
